Avoid a room above the pool - noise travels up. Great secure parking lot.

(see picture) The manager was super helpful offered to call 911 but we needed to be somewhere so, after bandages, we went on our way.

My fiance and I spent two nights here during a trip to Anaheim to visit Disney Land. Holiday Inn Express was an excellent choice and we were very happy with our stay - great location (would highly recommend taking the shuttle from the hotel to the park, made transportation so much easier and at $5.50 per ticket roundtrip it's a great deal), good complimentary breakfast, clean rooms, complimentary gated parking lot, and excellent pricing. This is a great place to stay if you're in the area for a visit to Disney, would highly recommend!
Manager Response: We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate you taking the time to leave us such great feedback! We hope to have you stay with us sometime in the near future!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, good pool and hot tub
Summary: Nice hotel, good pool and hot tub. The pool was just big enough to swim laps in. The beds are comfy, the shower has good pressure. No other problems in the bathroom - even has a fan. Not a lot of restaurants in the immediate walking area, but many a short drive away. Breakfast - no waffles, but they do have the auto-pancake machine.
Manager Response: We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate you taking the time to leave us such great feedback! We hope to have you stay with us sometime in the near future!

Manager Response: We appreciate greatly you taking your time to stay with us. It was a pleasure having you and your family stay with us during your vacation! We are glad to hear that you will be returning and hope to make your next visit just as nice as your last!

The free breakfast is one of the best we have had - a large variety of foods and efficient staff keeping things tidy and well stocked. Only downside is rather thin walls, you can hear next doorâ€™s tv in the evenings. However, would definitely stay here again.

No refrigerator was included in my room so ask in advance if you need one. Air conditioning was very noisy. Laundry room was accessible and I experienced no problem with machines. Staff was attentive to those needing coins.

We stayed 2 nights they came to clean our room at 5 pm and since we had just returned it didnâ€™t get cleaned. There is only one elevator which was often being used by housekeeping. Loud ac. Also the front doors are not automatic so difficult to get in with luggage. Staff were not very friendly or helpful. Would not recommend.

Summary Heading: Moderate your expectations and you'll be fine
Summary: If you are looking for a budget option near Disneyland with a park shuttle, included breakfast, decent rooms, and a basic pool, this will do. The building overall is dated, housekeeping does what it can but there is a lot of wear and tear to walls, doors, elevator, furniture, etc. No fridge in rooms but there is a small coffee maker. Shower water is hot and water pressure is good. If you stand in the right spot you can see Disney fireworks from the rooms. Hallways are noisy and walls are thin. Smoking and non-smoking rooms can be next to each other and the hallways also often smelled of smoke. I saw lots of families and the place felt safe. I stayed here for one night. This Holiday Inn Express was not bad. I had a clean room with a nice bed. I was disappointed that my room didn't have a fridge. Breakfast was good. Not sure why you have to have a key to get on to the elevator. I don't believe that's needed. The staff was okay, they were nice but not really attentive. The hotel is also in a nice location. Close to Disney and the beaches. Also right off the California 55 freeway. Overall I thought my stay was good. I fo believe it's a good hotel to stay at.

Breakfast was good and the lady who cleans the tables at the breakfast works so hard!  I would stay again if I was in the area.

Summary: This hotel is located close to all of the Anaheim attractions. It is clean, comfortable, modern and had a nice selection for breakfast with healthier options than most free breakfasts at economy hotels. I would stay again.

But easy to get around as you are not in the city or paying high prices. Older hotel but very clean and tidy. Pool and gym and the usual breakfast at Holiday Inns. Only Holiday Inn, that I have stayed at, approx 35, that check you in for breakfast, not sure why? The only issue we have here and it is nothing major but sometimes can be frustrating... is that most of the staff do not have English as their first language. The only Improvement I would suggest is to get automatic front doors at entrance. Difficult when your hands are full trying to juggle luggage etc and also get the door open.

We are confident that necessary steps will be made, in order to achieve complete guest satisfaction.  Again, thank you for staying and we hope you give us another chance to show you how great our hotel is.     Best Regards,    John O  Case Manager  IHGService

I spent a week sick after staying there. If you are using scented air freshener throughout the hotel you need to tell your guest. I happen to be very allergic to any type of fragrance.

Friendly staff, clean room, and a great breakfast with plenty of choices (the pancake machine was awesome). I printed my airline boarding pass before checking out and got a cup of coffee to go. I am an IHG member and prepaid my room for the best price. No complaints!

No Welcome Bonus Point/Amenity Point was deposited during my stay which all Holiday Inn & Holiday inn Express honor that if you are IHG member. Talked to an agent and he told me I will get my point within soon and talked to another agent again said that I will not get any point since I was staying under reward nights. In fact, the room I was in had poor wifi reception, to the point that I could not get any of my devices to connect to the hotel wifi.  The fan in the bathroom pulled cigarette smoke in from adjacent rooms, creating a terrible odor.  The hotel seemed rather tired and worn, but was clean and comfortable.  The bed was firm but comfortable. I left for an early flight so I can't speak to the quality of the breakfast.

Summary: This is my third time at this hotel and I choose it because of the location to Angels Stadium.  This is a short and easy drive to the Stadium.  typical HIXP.  The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable.  The staff was very friendly at check in that check out.  Typical HIEX breakfast with lots of hot and cold options.  Given the location to many attractions this is a good choice for those who like HIEX and want to save a couple of dollars compared to the other hotels closer to the attractions.

We stay one night at this hotel. The front desk staff is not so friendly and not helpful. The room was not well prepared. The bed is kind of hard and not comfort. The breakfast is poor. The waiter was rude in way of cleanning the table. We probably not return to this hotel.

Summary Heading: Awesome Staff; no fridge in room
Summary: This is a beautiful facility, nicely appointed, but not a new HIE.  The front desk staff make you feel so welcome...they're warm and friendly.  The rooms, though, do not have fridges or microwaves.  Only the suites do.  Also, the 24 hour coffee is only coffee, no decaf.  Also, there is a check-in person at breakfast every morning.

This is the third time we've stayed at this hotel. Previous stays were ok but a parking structure which used to make it convenient to get into the hotel has been removed since our last stay and a "security gate" has been added to gain entry to parking. Unfortunately, once you get your vehicle parked there is no clear markings on the building showing how to gain entry back into the hotel and you have to wander to the back of the building to get in. You need to park your car right in front of the entrance to the hotel(blocking other customers) to check in and then you get a key which will open the security gate....The security gate was operating on one side of the building but was broken on the other side...it is still very inconvenient to the hotel's access. We will not stay here

This appears to be a property that has been renovated and possibly rebranded as a HI Express since the rooms are not as large as many we have stayed.  The front desk staff could be more customer oriented however by contrast the ladies in the breakfast room are wonderful...especially with children.  In summary, good reasonable place to stay if you have a car to get around Anaheim....

The staff are pleasant, non pretentious and are prepared to make your visit a pleasant experience. Especially the restaurant staff.  Tristin at the Front desk and Ingry at the restaurant are one of the two really stands out. I observed Ingry assist another guests across from our table during breakfast and It's amazing to see her dedication to the guests.   The Location is perfect for guests coming to he Disney area, and unlike most comments regarding room cleanliness. The room was spacious, clean and quite welcoming.  Kudos to the management team. Will definitely return.

Stayed here for only an evening, yet I found the room to be a bit of a different story. Walked into the bathroom and found numerous spots with a mysterious black dots. I believe it's mold. There was a crack in the corner of one wall, concerning. Walls were paper thin and you could hear people in other rooms yelling. Reading other reviews it seems difficult to see what's good about the hotel. It's time for a clean up of the rooms. The breakfast was weak and cheap for what we paid for. I wish there was a word to describe the decor, oh wait, it's dated and the chairs in the hallway on the 3rd floor were ugly! The only positive was the front desk staff.

Sincerely,  Dianne L. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Hotel charged us $1500 in error (after promising zero charges) and refuses to refund. Nothing short of criminal. Highly recommend finding honest people to do business with. Manager refuses to answer messages and the company's customer service reps just say that their hotels are independently owned and operated and they can't override management decisions.
Manager Response: Hi Kimberly V,  Thank you for staying with us recently and for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Allow me to apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced with some of our amenities and services. I have sent you a private message in an effort to follow up on your concerns. Your comments are truly appreciated as we take these as an opportunity to improve in everything we do for our valued guests.   I look forward to your response.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGservice

Summary: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on Thanksgiving Day 2016. The staff was gracious enough to allow us to check-in early! We were super tired because we had been driving all night. We got to our room which had two queen sized beds. The room was very basic but clean. The beds were firm and super comfy. The t.v. stations didn't get good reception but that wasn't a big deal.  There was a nice pool and jacuzzi where the kids played in. The free hot breakfast offered egg omelets, toast, hot/cold cereal, juices, and pastries.  We had a good experience and would visit again. It is roughly 3 miles from Disneyland and they have a free shuttle. The staff was very helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Centella9,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us. We are happy to know that you liked our beds and we certainly appreciate your nice feedback on our staff, pool and breakfast selection. On the other hand, we would like to apologize for not living up to your expectations regarding our rooms and TV channel reception. Reviews like yours are very valuable as they enable us to target areas we need to improve on. Rest assured your feedback will be forwarded to the appropriate departments for evaluation.  We value you as our guest and hope to accommodate you again for a chance to provide you with a much better experience.  Sincerely,  Joel A Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Misleading photos on hotel website had me expecting a nicely decorated, updated room. I was disappointed, the room was ugly. Worn out, uncomfortable furniture. There was no microwave or refrigerator, as advertised on Hotels.com. When I complained I was told there was nothing they could do and it was a Hotels.com problem. Hotels.com was great and refunded my costs. We found another hotel and left. When we informed the guy at the desk he offered to upgrade our room. Too late.   We overheard the guest ahead also had trouble with his reservation. Poor customer service and ugly rooms. Stay away.
Manager Response: Dear travelingm0m2008,  Thank you for your candid review of your stay. We value each feedback as this will allow us to identify areas that may benefit from additional attention. It is regrettable to know that you found the condition of the room to be disappointing. In line with this, we sent you a private message to obtain more information about this matter.  Thank you for being our guest and looking forward hearing from you soon.   Sincerely,  Christian C. Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: QUICK TO TAKE YOUR MONEY (MORE THAN AUTHORIZED) BUT SLOW TO REFUND/RELEASE
Summary: Stayed here earlier in the year for almost a week for a church conference we attended and we absolutely had no problem. Our stay was awesome! The 1st night there our car was INFESTED with hundreds of ants from the parking lot bushes they got all up in the engine and came through the vents and speakers in the car. Told the staff they didn't even come look at the car after we waited out there for half an hour had to buy multiple cans of raid and ant traps for the inside of the car as well as power wash the engine staff didn't seem to show sympathy and refused to give us a refund to go somewhere else. Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Purposely left this review a few weeks
Summary: We stayed at this HiExp as it was close to friends who live in nearby Stanton.  We normally stay at the Crown Plaza in Costa Messa.  However, this is a newer hotel and closer, so we thought we would give it a try.  I am a Platinum Holiday Inn Member; this was not recognized by the receptionist and we were not offered an upgrade, given an apology for this or given our normal choice of a 500 extra points or a room gift.   I waited till the end of the booking in procedure and mention this.  The lady standing next to my receptionist, apologized saying that it was a trainee who had booked us in.  Still no offer of a room upgrade or points or gift.  I then mention this and asked to see the manager.  A guy soon came (Reception Manager, I guess), apologized and offered us 5000 points.
Manager Response: Dear Stephen P,  Thank you for taking the time to express your thoughts and concerns. We are pleased to know you liked the room accommodations you received and the breakfast selections we offer. We would like to apologize for the experience you had during check and the service you received fell below your expectations. We have sent you a private message to obtain some additional details. Thank you for staying and we look forward to hearing from you soon.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Great location and the set up of the hotel was very nice.  Pool location was really good and easy access.  The  breakfast buffet had a good variety and was well stocked.   Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Had a bit of a "staycation", spent two nights here. We had booked over a month in advance and specifically requested a corner room as we had gotten the first time we stayed here, and upon arrival we were given one of the regular hallway rooms that they had left and said that the corner rooms were full. I guess requesting over a month advance wasn't good enough?   But anyway, the room was of the same standard as before, it was comfortable with all the regular necessities, though the free wifi was spotty. They got new coffee machines in the room, a change from the last time we stayed a year ago, and the shampoos etc were nice bath & body works ones now. The tub wasn't too clean but the rest of the room and bathroom was alright. The free breakfast was pretty good and had everything
Manager Response: Dear omgitsgale,  Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. We are pleased to know you had a comfortable stay and liked the proximity of our property in the area. On the other hand, we are sorry we are not able to honor your request for a corner room and also the cleanliness of your tub fell short of your expectations. Your feedback is very important to us as this continually helps us improve the facilities and guest services we offer to our guests. Thank you for staying and we all hope to serve you again on your next future visit.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGService

Summary: If I could rate a "0" I would. Horrible staff. Asked for change and the front desk female told me they don't give change to guests. That was odd considering i travel for business. Lack of communication between workers. Night auditor told me they don't accommodate late checkouts regardless of IHG status because the hotel is constantly full. I understand that but 1 late checkout isn't going to hurt especially if the guests is a platinum member. Just goes to show the hotel doesn't value the IHG members. This leaves a bad image for the brand.
Manager Response: Dear Mike B,  Thank you so much for your review of our hotel as we value you as an IHG Rewards Club Platinum member. We look forward to hearing back from you very soon.  Sincerely,     Zelyn N Case Manager  IHGService

Summary Heading: Service is great; hotel is sad
Summary: This hotel is as clean as they can make it considering what they have to work with; which is not good. We had reservations for 3 nights but cancelled and just stayed one night because the hotel is so run down. The staff however is amazingly good. Breakfast staff was so helpful and thoughtful but it just cannot compensate for the shabbiness of the actual structure.  If they renovate after this date then it might be worth another look. But seriously if you stay check out the couch on level 2 OMG
Manager Response: Dear Margy B,  Thank you for staying with us, and for leaving feedback regarding your experience. We are pleased to read you enjoyed the staff service and breakfast options. On the other hand, please accept our apologies if the overall quality at the hotel did not meet your expectations. Your comments are much appreciated and will be used to focus on improvements. We would love to welcome you back and give us another try.  Kind Regards,  Tracy V. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: ~15 min bus ride to Disneyland in the morning from right in front of the hotel - $5 for an all day bus ticket that can be purchased at the front desk. Bus runs hourly and picks up at the half hour from the hotel (7:30 am bus got us to the front of the castle before 8 am). Longer bus ride returning from Disney since the hotel is the last stop (~30 min).  Room was very clean and bathroom was very clean though not the most modern. Wifi and breakfast in the morning is included. Front desk was helpful and friendly. Good food options are about 1/2 a mile away (10-15 min walk) - but some offer free delivery. Gas station is close by to pick up water / snacks. Overall, the hotel is a great option if you're going to spend all day at the park anyway.

Getting early to a property is always sketchy...in that housekeeping hasn't had time to get all the rooms ready (including the one you wanted).  But when we arrived to the Holiday Inn Express Garden Grove - we were met with a great smile from a wonderful front desk manager - Alexa Vanegas.  We were exhausted because we didn't get a good night sleep the night before and just finished a grueling drive up the I-5 from San Diego.  She didn't have the room type requested, but she looked and looked and found a room that we could crash in until ours was ready.  I was utterly shocked that she went through all the vacant rooms to find one that we would be happy in till ours was ready - but she did.  And to me that's GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!  And she deserves a GOLD STAR for her efforts to

This holiday Inn is just ok. Plenty of parking though!!  Check in was quick and they have luggage carts. They really need an automatic front door so it's easier to bring your stuff in. My room was on the small side but alright. Wish it had a mini fridge because the only ice machine is on the 2nd floor. Kinda inconvenient. Decent TV with a good channel selection but some channels had static. Bathroom was clean and had plenty of towels. Wish they were a little softer though. Bed was alright and had plenty of pillows. Surprisingly the heating and ac worked fine. One thing that was annoying was the fact my window faced where they are doing some kind of construction so at 7am it's loud music and tools blasting me out of bed. Breakfast was good as usual for a hotel quick bite. Pool

We stayed there for 4 nights for universal studios horror nights and disneyland,shuttle stoped just in front of hotel,area is not that bad,there was enough parking every night and it was really quiet.We never went for breakfast but they told me that it was good.Going back in december with wife and kids and i will probably stay there again.

Summary Heading: Stayed here for a Wedding nearby
Summary: Stayed here in early February with my boyfriend. We liked the hotel overall, it had complimentary parking and breakfast. Also, it was very close to the wedding reception that we attended that weekend. The lady at the breakfast room was very nice, she gave me a tray to take to my room to eat breakfast there. The personnel at the lobby were very friendly too.

My son had a tour of Vans headquarters so we chose this holiday inn express.  We weren't disappointed. Smooth check in.  Platinum members had reserved parking.  Went to restaurant suggested by front desk - it was awesome.  Breakfast was awesome -- they had ham!!!  Very clean and smooth checkout. Disney very close but we didn't plan a visit there.

Summary Heading: Really Needs an Update - And Not Worth the $$$
Summary: First of all, this property was the "host hotel" for a nearby conference that our group attended.  Supposedly, we had a "group rate," but discovered from other guests - who were there simply to go to Disneyland - that their rate was the same as ours.    The property is - definitely - lovely on the outside.  The driveway can easily be missed when coming from the interstate as it is right next to a Candlewood Inn & Suites (their rates were MUCH lower!!).  The front doors of the facility are also difficult to navigate with luggage (they don't slide open like most hotels - you have to give them a good PULL).  The lobby is nice enough, but the rooms are very much dated as are the hallways.    Here are some other "cons" -  *We had to unplug the coffee pot and lamp in order to have an

Summary: Great location, facility, staff and overall experience. We stayed over on a rainy Saturday night. Wonderful and comfortable room, beds and great breakfast the next morning for a reasonable price. No complaints.

The lobby of the hotel looks very nice and looks as if it has been updated recently... The rooms were nice and clean. The beds were decency comfortable. The breakfast was very nice and probably one of the better breakfasts I've seen from a hotel. Thank you.
Manager Response: Dear Dylan D,  Thank you very much for taking the time to share your thoughts and comments regarding your stay with us. Reviews like yours motivate us to work harder to continuously provide the best guest experience possible.  Thank you for choosing our hotel and we look forward to accommodating your again in the future.  Best Regards,  Joel A Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Hotel In Need of a Refresh
Summary: The hotel has a great outside appearance, which is a bit deceptive. The guest floors are very dated and in desperate need of a refresh. The hallway carpets are old, stained and coming loose. The guest rooms are also a bit dated with worn furnishings and carpet. We had several cracked and loose tiles in our bathroom. The mattress on our bed was older and very uncomfortable -- you could feel springs coming through.   The highlight of this hotel was definitely the staff. At check-in, the Front Desk Agent was very helpful in finding a room away from the street. The ladies working at the breakfast were incredibly efficient. It was extremely busy, but they were right on top of everything. The moment guests were finished, one of them would swoop in and seconds later the table was
Manager Response: Dear CincyFlier,  Thank you for your stay and for leaving a review about our hotel on TripAdvisor. Summary: We are annual pass holders for Disneyland and this is our go to place to stay. it has a shuttle that picks you up right in front and takes you right to the entrance of the parks  (for a small fee, they sell the tickets in the hotel as well). it has a small breakfast buffet with a large variety from hot meals, cold cereal, fruit, danishes and grab and go items. different juices, milk and coffee. the staff is always nice and depending on availability, you might be able to check in a little earlier. usually quiet. beds aren't anything compared to my tempurpedic at home, but they are comfy enough for the time we are there.

The rooms were very clean, friendly and accommodating staff. Breakfast was great.  I have zero complaints. I would most definitely go back. I only wish it was closer to the convention center and Disneyland.

Stayed in enjoy with friends and family and had a great time. The hotel was a little worn down but the staff were friendly. The location is pretty good, parking was good, the pool was okay and the breakfast was ok too. I guess my stay was just ok ðŸ˜Š

Stay Nov 20,21 2015 this is the 2nd time staying at this Holiday Inn Express & Suites Garden Grove Anaheim. Free breakfast buffet they had main breakfast essentials coffee, tea, and juice they ask for room number. Room was clean toiletries and towels were replaced everyday. Our room came with a small fridge and microwave, 2 queen beds, couch, coffee table. They offered free parking and free WiFi. Popeyes, and Subway, Gas stations, short walk away. They is a shuttle to Disneyland there is a charge $5.00 you can buy it at front desk. They will pick you up at the hotel. Nice neighborhood. Felt safe. I will stay here again.

The property is one of the most reasonably priced hotels in the area.  For that reason I return here for business each month.  The staff is usually friendly and helpful.  However, on this trip, the front desk people did not greet me as a Spire member (I had to remind them), nor did they have an upgrade for me (which is usually done for me as a repeat customer).The front desk finally found a quiet standard room in the back on the 3rd floor.  There is construction on one wing of the property as well on the east side.  The breakfast staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  They well maintain the various food offerings.  Wifi is free but at times slow.  This property is well maintained.  It is a shame that they have downsized the fitness room.  For future visits to this area, I

Summary Heading: Great hotel although a little off the beaten path
Summary: This is a great hotel!  Friendly staff, good breakfast and plenty of seating.  Nice and clean room.  It was a little further than we expected and there really isn't much around the hotel in regards to walking distance.  But if you have a car, then it works just fine because there is plenty within just a few miles.  Parking was never an issue.  Lots of spaces and plenty of lighting when returning at night.  Elevator is a little slow, but not terrible.  Pool area was nice - very refreshing after a day at the park and even enjoyed the hot tub.  Disneyland is about 10-20 minutes away depending upon traffice (and where they are having you park that day).

I've often found that Holiday Inn Express is very consistent with service and hotel quality but was disappointed in our stay in Garden Grove. The lobby was nice but our room felt dated and dark. No mention was made at check in that construction would start early the next morning right outside our window and an attempt to have the front desk quiet an extraordinarily loud crowd in the room above ours was unsuccessful. The mattresses felt old and we're not very comfortable, same for the pillows. I don't really care much for recognition but it is nice being greeted as a rewards club member with the usual gesture of a complimentary bottle of water or snack especially when I'm checking in late at night on a business trip, which did not take place in Garden Grove. Not sure if I will

Summary Heading: Overall great, room a little dated
Summary: Our family stayed overnight for a short Disney weekend. The staff was fantastic, working with us to allow a little early check in to settle in before Disneyland. Breakfast in the morning was great, with a variety of hot and cold options, with a cool pancake machine that the kids got a kick out of.  Overall, we would rate the stay higher, but our room left a but to be desired. The A/C was very noisy, while it was not very hot, the room was a bit musty and we needed the a/c to dry out the air. The beds are also getting old, squeaky springs and sagging towards the edges. But, the room was very clean, towels softer than you'd expect in a hotel, so it served its purpose.

I stayed 3 nights for a congress at convention center. The hotel was mostly used by families with children, directed to Disneyland amusements. This was evident only at breakfast. Noisy but not disturbing. Rooms are comfortable, as in the standards of Holiday Inn. Even more comfirtable the free parking, the free wifi and the free late checkout. Breakfast food according the (low) standards of Holiday Inns and of American junk food. Both convention center and disneyland are not at walking distance and the car is required to do everything.

We booked our room online, as we always have. We believed in good faith that we booked correctly. One room with a single queen bed and one with two queen beds. We all checked in together. Two people for the one queen bed room, three for the two queen bed room. We were given two room keys for each room. However, after enjoying the "free" breakfast the next morning, we were suddenly and very sternly questioned by staff about the size of our group. Hours after checking out and leaving the location, we received a phone call stating that we had only booked one person per room (who books a two queen bed suite for one person?) and informing us that we were going to receive additional charges for our "extra" guests who, again, were with us at check-in, with no questions or mentions of

The next morning after we all arrived to breakfast at separate times we were hounded by the buffet police and everyone showed their keys as requested. Summary: Spent the night while on business.   The hotel looks a little worn but that's not a bad thing.  Check in was very quick.   People at front desk very welcoming.   Room was nicely appointed.   Bed was comfortable and the room quiet, even though I faced the street.  Breakfast was very good.  The hot foods were very fresh and well stocked.  The area very clean.   Coffee hot.   It was a nice way to start the day.  I don't get to California often but if I'm back in the area for work, I will return.  My only knock on the property was a very very slow internet connection.  So much so, that I couldn't get work done.  That was frustrating.
Manager Response: Dear TherealVman,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay. I am glad to know that we were able to meet your expectations when it comes to providing friendly and comfortable accommodations. On the other hand, allow me to apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced with the internet service provided. Please be assured that this concern will be looked into.   Thank you again for your feedback and I do hope that we will get another chance to welcome you back.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: This hotel pleasantly surprised me and my dad for our one night stay. It has a beautiful exterior and a really nice lobby area. The staff at the front desk were friendly and answered our questions (we ended up changing around our reservations). The rooms were clean and actually quite nice, and the bathrooms are stocked with Bath and Body Works products. The beds, however, were SOLID. They were probably the hardest hotel beds I've slept on in a while, and my family travels constantly to Anaheim. In my opinion, if you're tired enough whether it's from travel, Disneyland with family or friends, or business neetings you can probably sleep on them. The breakfast was very well adorned with all sorts of food: cinnamon rolls, pancakes, cereal, fruit, eggs, sausage, oatmeal, yogurt, etc.

Stayed here for 4 nights. Very clean hotel, nice staff, breakfast area is probably the cleanest I have seen of any hotel. Their breakfast staff was so friendly and helpful.  Good hot breakfast every morning including a pancake machine. The only complaint is have is that the WiFi in our room (3rd floor) was awful! We ate up so much of our data using our own hot spot because of it. Other than that, this is a great family friendly hotel.

Stayed here 9/22/15-9/25/15. This is an "OK" place to stay, nothing special. Breakfast was typical, synthetic eggs/omlettes with Cheese Wizz. Internet (wi-fi) was s-l-o-w. Nearly broke my neck on uneven sidewalk leading to pool-should either be fixed or highlighted so it's visible. I wouldn't go out of my way to stay here again, but it wasn't an unpleasant experience. Staff was friendly.

Rest assured that your comments will be reviewed by our team and take actions accordingly to correct unsatisfactory experiences.  Once again, thank you for your review and we hope that you would consider staying with us again in order to show our improvements.  Sincerely,  Divina P. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: It's a very clean and nice property. All of the people that we interacted with were very nice and helpful. The room was a King Suite. Again very clean and comfortable. The A/C worked very, very well. My wife was able to keep it cold it the room. We did not eat the breakfast like we usually do.  I would/will stay here again!

I usually stay at this property each month when in town for business.  It has great location (ease to various freeways and Disneyland for tourists).  The entrance lobby is very welcoming and roomy.  If this property is booked in advanced, the room rate is of great value when compared to other properties in the area.  The front desk staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful - especially Daniel.  They dress in a professional manner. The scooter arrived early, and the front desk called us to advise that when we were ready to pick it up, it would be waiting in a security hold at the front desk.  Any time I needed to store the scooter, they were happy to assist without any trouble.    This hotel is on the shuttle bus line (for local parks transportation) which charges a reasonable fee.  We decided to use our own vehicle during the park days for ease

But the pool worked for our needs and parking was free. It is a very quick drive to Disney but too far to walk. The staff was very nice. We left before the breakfast opened but they let me into grab a milk and cereal for my kiddo. They also grabbed me a milk the night before. I really appreciated their help as I was traveling with a toddler alone.  If they have a shuttle to Disney I will come back again. The room prices reflect the Ned to remodel but very reasonable for the proximity to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great stay - close to Disneyland - great value!
Summary: We booked this hotel through Getaway Today and loved that the room rate included free breakfast and free parking daily.  We stayed 4 nights, 12/26-12/29 in room 316 which was on the 3rd floor, down the hall and overlooked the pool.  It was quiet all night, very clean and exactly what we needed after fighting the crowds all day at Disneyland.  The staff was very friendly, the breakfast was great with hot foods like sausage and eggs refilled often and my son loved the automatic pancake machine.  It was a great stay and we will choose this hotel when we visit Disneyland again.

All the staff at this hotel were friendly and very welcoming. Our room was a good size and kept very clean and tidy by house keeping, toiletries were replaced every day. We used the free wifi. Breakfast was very good and was always busy. (Cereals/toast/make your own pancakes/sausage,egg,bacon etc/muffins & hot cinnamon rolls). Lots of free parking. Ice machine was available and free coffee in the lobby.  The corridor carpets could do with replacing and the room doors painted but these are minor things and did not affect the enjoyment of our stay. We would stay here again. Well done to the lovely staff of this hotel.

Summary Heading: Great location that includes a hot breakfast! (Most Disneyland Hotels Dont)
Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The beds were comfortable, the parking was free and the breakfast was good. Most hotels around Disneyland do not include a hot breakfast so we stayed at Holiday Inn to save money. We really enjoyed our stay.

This is a very clean and nice place to stay as close to Desneyland and other shopping places......It has a very good and tasty continental breakfast......The room was very clean, roomy, bed comfy and the only thing it did not have was a fridge......So if need bring a small cooler....But all in all this is a great getaway....The staff was nice and help full.

Only problem was our room wasn't serviced the next day but we overlooked that since all we really did was sleep. Bathroom was clean and had great body products. Breakfast was prob one if the best in a hotel that gives free breakfast out. I'd recommend for those who don't care where they stay for a great cheap rate, minus the room not being serviced and having to use hand towels after the shower.

We have always stayed within walking distance to Disneyland so we had never driven before.  The drive is very close and easy! We will be staying again!!  Thank you!

This hotel charges premium prices (almost $120 total for two people for one night, mid-week, off-peak) and they don't deliver. This place is in need of serious renovation.  Pluses: Very pleasant staff, offered us bottled water at check-in (we had traveled for about five hours before arriving). Location is decent - although for the price they are charging, they aren't that close to any major destinations in the area. Our room would have been a decent value at maybe half what we paid for it.  Minuses: Small room. Permanent stains on the carpet. Two phones in the room, both were dead (found this out when I tried to call the front desk to find out where the ice machine was).

I have never felt so at home in any hotel and we have stayed at many as we have been season pass holders to Disneyland for several years. On top of the amazing staff this hotel is clean, the pool is heated and they have a breakfast that is a perfect jump start to your day. Before staying I was a little nervous about the shuttle but it was easy! With free parking and Wi-Fi I would be surprised if you find a better deal in the Disney resort

We used the shuttle ($5 a day per person) to get to Disneyland.  It was on time, air conditioned and took about 15 mins. A nice alternative if u don't want to pay for parking. Summary: This hotel was comfortable and really clean! Very exceptional customer service. The pool was nice. the people were nice. I had windows facing Disneyland and could watch the fireworks from my room. I really liked this hotel.

Summary Heading: Nothing special, but nothing bad either
Summary: As far as hotels are concerned, this is your average hotel. Nothing amazing, nothing bad. It's about 3.5 miles from Disneyland and is serviced via Shuttle if you don't want to park your car at the Disneyland parking lots. You are limited to the hours the shuttle operates, so if you like to stay until the park closes at midnight on select days, the shuttle service might not be a great idea for getting back. However, you're far enough away to avoid most of the crowds and noise when you're ready to sleep.  The hotel only has one elevator so it can be slow going if things get busy. I also did not use the pool or any gym facilities.  Staff was friendly and answered all my questions. You can get shuttle tickets at the desk and save money that way.  I've stayed there once before a few

They were very helpful with providing menu's for us to feed some very hungry boys after a long day of travelling from Victoria, B.C. Canada.  Holiday Inn Express is a great choice for travelling teams as it provides a great combination of hot and cold breakfast choices. Quietest hotel I've experienced in years! Comfortable, clean, large rooms, very friendly staff (especially Daniel). Great location - convenient to get to Disneyland, but far enough to get a better rate and better amenities (free parking, free breakfast, free wi-fi). Would recommend.

The breakfast was pretty good and the pool area was nice, all things runners look for. For the price I paid it was well worth it. Friendly staff, comfy bed, and clean bathrooms...will stay here again!

We stayed for the night before Thanksgiving, since we were spending 2 days at Disneyland.  The location is an easy 10 minute drive from the park, which is only a few minutes further than most of the Anaheim hotels.  The Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) bus travels to/from the park every hour, for $4, but we had a car and free parking with our pass (otherwise, Disney parking is $16 so the bus is a good option).  One very good thing about staying in Garden Grove is that the hotel parking is free and plentiful, unlike many Anaheim hotels.  I was upgraded to a suite as a platinum reward member, and the room was wonderful for the price paid.  The highlight of the stay was that the hotel offered turkey, stuffing, potatoes, and cranberry sauce, as a free compliment to their normal free

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel - located out of the "Anaheim / Disney Resort Area" and glad it was
Summary: This was my second year staying at this location for an IndyCar race in Fontana. I'm familiar with the Anaheim / Garden Grove area from numerous past stays. With this hotel, you don't pay the rates you would in the "Anaheim / Disney Resort Area" up to, and including resort and parking fees.  The hotel is clean and the staff is pleasant. Our initial room was in the back of the hotel, above a maintenance room and there was a constant low level noise and vibration present in the room. I asked to be moved to the opposite side of the hotel and the woman at the front desk was able to switch us to a different room despite the limited availability and it was very much appreciated.  The condition of the room was clean, however the mattress on our bed was not very good and I ended up with

Summary Heading: Decent Stay but problem with cleaniness.
Summary: Appreciated the free breakfast, standard fare of other Holiday Inn Express plus/minus a couple of items.  Liked the pancake maker but a waffle machine would have been nice.  Appreciated the free wifi but would have liked a computer center, surprised there wasn't one or maybe I missed it.  Had a baby crib in the room when we got there.  First place to actually remember, reserved several other locations and they always seemed to forget or set up the baby crib after the fact.  Only one ice machine on the first floor, can't you install one on each floor?  The carpets need to be cleaned (steamed) or replaced as it's getting a liittle bit old.  The coffee maker in the rooms have to be replaced, looks like it's really old and makes the rooms feel dirty.  I personally don't use the

Summary Heading: A very solid and good Holiday Inn Express
Summary: I stayed here during a recent business trip when my primary hotel was sold out.  This is very solid hotel with no major issues.  It's not dated per se but shows a bit of age - I  do not believe it has gone through a renovation as IHG has been during recent years.  However, the hotel is well kept, nice and clean.  Staff was friendly and give me a nice goodie bag for being IHG Platinum member.  The room is spacious and bathroom is fairly clean but the hallways don't feel as clean and had some kind of odorl.  The gym is also quite decent for a Holiday Inn Express.  It has a couple of treadmills and one multi-station weight system, just enough to get my basic workout done.  Breakfast is the standard spread for Holiday Inn Express - mostly pre-prepared items that are heated up by the

Summary Heading: Quiet, really nice sized clean rooms, helpful staff
Summary: Our kids stayed here last year and they made the reservations for this trip and we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The lobby is large and beautiful furnished, the breakfast room is spacious and well stocked and the rooms were clean and well appointed.  There was plenty of free parking  and the lots are well lighted at night. There is a free shuttle to disneyland which is very close by.  We were very pleased and have already made reservations for another trip!

Hotel was a bit dirty.  The housekeeping staff seems to run the hotel. There is only one elevator and during the morning hours, do not get in the way of housekeeping. The staff took the elevator while leaving about 6-10 customers to wait.  They also need to invest in a vacuum as my room looked as if it had not been vacuumed in weeks. When I did see the staff vacuuming, it was a very old, LOUD machine.  Definitely not a favorite!
Manager Response: Dear D N,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us. We work diligently to ensure our facilities are well maintained and we try our hardest to provide not just good value, but comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations and for that please accept my sincere apology for the issues you have encountered during your stay with us.  Rest assured, your valuable comments are noted and will be forwarded to the appropriate department to be addressed accordingly. Your feedback is of great importance to us and allows us to monitor and improve our service continually.  Thank you for sharing your feedback, and we hope to have an opportunity to serve you again.  Sincerely,   Krysllin G Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: First off, we did not spend much time in the room.  We spent it at Disneyland! This hotel was clean, quiet, and comfortable. We found it on Priceline so it had a low rate. It was not far from the park, but we had to drive there.  This hotel is a stop on the Anaheim Resort Transit route, but we wanted access to our car quickly and not have to sit on a bus.  I would stay there again over any hotel closer to Disneyland.

After a long drive its always nice to get good service from people and that's exactly what we received. The cleanliness was good and the room  was in good order. The hotel is located about ten minutes away from Disneyland so you cant walk you have to drive but its away from all the hustle from around the park.

The rooms are  not clean at all. The carpet is nasty with black stains all over the place. The bathroom floor tiles are broken and you can see mold on the ceiling. Breakfast was the worst, as hot breakfast they have eggs and bacon or sausage but the only cook a little bit at the time and people have to wait about 15 minutes for them to cook a little bit more and then wait again. Besides that all employees are very gentle and respectful with customers.
Manager Response: Dear CESAR P,   Thank you for your recent stay with us and reviewing our property. Please accept my apologies for falling short of your expectations. Your comments about the cleanliness of the room and your breakfast experience have been documented and we are confident the necessary adjustments will be made, in order to achieve complete guest satisfaction. While we understand that your stay was not 100% satisfactory, we would hope that you would give us another chance to make your stay as best as it can be.  Sincerely,   Janice A Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary Heading: Free breakfast and 10 mins to disney
Summary: 10 minute drive from disneyland, free parking and free breakfast. Those were really the only selling points.  Rooms are decent size and clean.  Booked through priceline express deals ($79/night plus tax & fees.). Big bummer was that the hotel made me pay $15/night extra to secure 2 queen beds (family trip.) I don't think that's right, since they wouldn't make any other guest pay extra for a standard request like a room with 2 queen beds.   Breakfast was good: pancake machine, cereal, bagels, toast, pastries, coffee, yogurt, fruit, apple & orange juice, biscuits and gravy (scary), omelettes (microwave airplane) / scrambled eggs (ok), sausage patties or bacon (ok), cinnamon rolls (yummy).Overall, with a family, it was the free parking and breakfast that made it a good deal.   The

It is regrettable you were not satisfied with the service you received. I would like to address this with you further. I have sent you a private message to obtain more information about your stay. I look forward to hearing from you and being of further assistance.  Sincerely,   Karen C Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We arrived early to check in. Our room wasn't ready yet, but they were very nice to me and told me that we had been up graded to a suite. Went out to lunch and when we got back, the room was ready and waiting for us. The room was clean and on the first floor like I had requested. All of the front desk staff was so nice and friendly. No problems with anything and I will return here when in the area.

Summary Heading: Charged me for stay despite several day notice
Summary: I booked a reservation here. The week before my trip I became very sick and my doctor advised against travel as I had an ear infection and congested lungs.  I called the hotel to cancel my reservation and they refused. They claim I purchased a non-refundable reservation. Yet there was absolutely no indication given about this when I purchased. The print out I made of the reservation says nothing about not being able to cancel it with sufficient notice. I've been staying at Holiday Inn Express for years. This is the first time I've ever had a problem like this. I will never book at this location again.
Manager Response: Dear adam p,  Thank you for your feedback. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. Weâ€™re sorry about the cancellation policy. We will look into this point. We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We stayed here for two nights when we went to Disneyland. The staff, especially Mike were very helpful and accommodating. It was a short drive, not even five minutes from Disneyland parking in which we chose to drive ($15.00 parking) but the hotel has a shuttle that would have cost us 13.00 that travels to Disney every hour, just make sure you check ahead when the hour starts. Beds were comfy, room was clean and breakfast was decent. We would stay again. Target is down the street for snacks and they have some Disney items for sale;)

This hotel is good for families who want to save money on breakfast, and get a clean, reasonably priced place near the Disneyland resort.  If you are looking for comfort, this is not the place to stay.  They beds are rather hard and not very comfortable.  The rest of the room is typical of a Holiday Inn.  The breakfast is good but could be better if they would train the young woman working in the room to stay off of her phone and spend more time keeping the tables clean and refilling the hot items.  The hotel is about 10 min from Disneyland but an easy drive.  There are no food establishments close by.  Good hotel for a few nights at most.  For longer stays, try something closer to the Disney Resort.

Nothing exceptional other then free parking, free wi fi- for the area this is a plus. rooms were average..standard..check in was tiresome, new person at desk and it seemed she never heard of priority club members. good breakfast that is included, but making the reservations on the club line was an experience not very good. they certainly did not care about priority club or anything else. makes me think why so loyal all the time?
Manager Response: Dear srimanone,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to write a review. I am truly sorry that your stay with us was not up to your standards. We do value our IHG Rewards Club members and I apologize if this was not the case when you stayed with us. I do hope you would give us a chance to make it right and look forward to seeing you in the future.  Sincerely,   Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: All round good hotel with minor niggles
Summary: I stayed in this hotel with a large group (100+) and found it well-suited for that purpose. For example they have a separate meeting room that we used for breakfast for us to avoid crowding the regular breakfast room and the hotel was not too big (three floors) so we didn't lose anyone. Breakfast, by the way, was of high quality with a good selection. We were going on buses everywhere and it suited us fine as a central location for Disney, and even for LA and Hollywood. Sure it probably needs some refurbishing but the rooms were clean and everything (apart from WiFi) worked and the staff were great.  I'd rate even higher if these things were fixed: 1) WiFi - was either slow or not working at all 2) Hot water ran out at peak times 3) Overpowering cleaning material smell in the

Received great service front desk ,our room was spotlessly clean,bed was very comfortable .Everything work in the room as well . Can always count on getting a great room here .Breakfast was good too. Very close to Disneyland .

Check in was easy - our room wasnt ready when we arrived, but we did get there around 1:00.  I was disappointed but not a big deal, we changed, left our bags in thier secure storage and headed to the parks.    We picked this location because of the free parking.  It was about a 15 minute drive from the hotel parking lot to the Mickey & Friends Parking Structure.  Note a huge deal at all.  Sure at the end of the night you just want to be home right away but unless you are staying at a Disney resort on site this location was great.  The room was clean, very spacious, fairly comfortable beds and the free breakfast was perfect for us each day!    We did not use the

Summary Heading: Claen and nice staff, but not a nice night's sleep
Summary: This is an older motel, but clean and fairly well maintained.  However, the A/C is very noisy and, due to thin walls, you hear other room's A/C as well.  Not good for sleep.  The bed was not terribly comfortable either.  The breakfast had no oatmeal, which I eat every morning.  It probably was okay for those who want a higher fat breakfast, but not for me.  On the bright side, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was very clean, with a sheet both on top and under the blanket.  For the price in that area, it was a decent value and I would recommend it for those on a budget.
Manager Response: Dear Sierra_Gray_Wolf,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay with us. I'm glad that you found the staff friendly and helpful. Summary Heading: Clean & Welcoming Hotel Near Disney for a Reasonable Price!
Summary: It was a pleasant stay while my family and I visited Disneyland for the weekend.  The room was clean and had all the basic amenities for a good night sleep. Shuttle is provided to go to the park for $5/adult for the whole day. We took the shuttle which they dropped us just walking distance to both parks. The hotel is not near where all other Disney hotels are yet not far at all for the price I paid. Genuinely hotel staff from beginning to end of our Disney trip. Would stay here again when we come back to Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Unorganized, rude, dirty room, no manager on duty
Summary: I stayed at this propty aprox. One week ago. To sum ot up in one sentence I would have to say worst experience Ive ever had. I used to love staying here with my husband, we normally stayed once or twice a month just to get away from the kids. Jonathan the manager was always so helpful and made sure we had exactly what we needed. $100 a night and we never had problems. And Yolanda the front desk woman was always so polite in the mornings. But i guess they must have got a new manager because jonathan is no longer with the company aparently and they have all these people who barley speak english. Summary: Special thanks to the manager of this Holiday Inn Express (Jonathan).  He knows what remarkable service is all about.  My family has a warm place in our heart as a result of service rendered.  Jonathan went above and beyond for our family.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: Good Place - The Staff Makes the Difference
Summary: Have stayed here 3 or 4 times on the trips over for Disneyland. The entire staff has always bent over backwards to help us for whatever need we may have. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Will definitely continue to stay here.

Great place, good price and great pool and jacuzzi, both of them with heated water. No doubt best choice around. Breakfast included with a large choice of donuts and juice. Paid 94 usd a night + taxes. Great Plasma TV.

I was expecting a little better from this hotel. On the holiday inn express chart this will be average at best. There is better choices near by. I've stayed at many hie and being a mile from Disney I thought it should been better than it was. Next time I stay elsewhere.

So i stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, Breakfast choices were fine. The hitch is the hotel staff. Except for the Asian lady on the desk who was nice and tried to help us. The other staff were just plain stupid. Breakfast area gets crowded very quickly because the room is bit small and not enough for the hotel of this size. they had this one computer in the hallway for the guests. Coffee is better not to try.  I called them few days earlier to inquire about the disney tickets if they sell them. The lady on the desk excused for few minutes and then told that they dont sell the tickets there. When i reached the hotel i saw everywhere big posters in the hotel saying "We sell disney tickets here".  ... I also inquired about the shuttle

Staff was exemplary.  Room was better than I expected, very clean and modern.  Breakfast, while crowded with a soccer team, was good.  The only complaint I have is that the a/c under the window was VERY noisy.  Would have been better design to reverse the couch set up and the bed so it was away from street noise and a/c unit.  The ART comes by once an hour, and goes to two malls and Disneyland park as well as a couple street stops.   I found it much easier to drive to the Toy Story lot and take the shuttle to the park from there.    Thank you for the water bottles and answered questions at check in!  For half the cost of a closer to the park room (OH, and they don't charge for parking like the closer motels!), I give it a thumbs up!

We stay here every time we visit LA as it's in a very convenient location off the highway and not too far from downtown Disney. Rooms are always great, no issues with the wifi; friendly and helpful staff; breakfast is good - basically we are always very pleased with our stay here. The only suggestion I can think of is that it would be nice if they had an ice machine on every floor. I can't remember which but there isn't one on either the second or third floor which is a pain when you have to go all the way to another floor using the slow lift just to get ice.

Summary Heading: Has the ABC's of Hotel Happiness
Summary: A=Accessible to many area attractions without being too busy - about 3 miles from Disneyland, but easy freeway access that took about 3 -5 minutes to drive to the parks garage. B=Breakfast included!  (HOT breakfast - eggs, sausage or bacon, biscuits & gravy, yogurt, pancakes, bagels, toast, or danish, juice & coffee plus more) need I say more? C=Comfortable quite and clean rooms.  The pillows left much to be desired, but I always bring my favorite - so I survived - otherwise would have requested a few extras.    Staff was friendly and helpful - when we asked for a close market we were sent to one that had been closed for business for what seemed to be some time - but we're pretty resourceful so we managed - I did not like that there was no safe in the room - but was impressed

Stayed one night. First room did'nt have a fridge which we needed but they agreed to switch to another room. But wifi was very poor, weak signal and couldn't use our devices in the room which they advertised as having wifi. Front desk staff had average service. Breakfast food was standard and  kept clean. Room rate was average(85.00). We'll continue to stay a Holiday Inn Expresses.

I stayed here one night.  Everything, including the front lobby, was scrupulously clean.  I asked for a quiet room and got one on the third floor, also scrupulously clean.  The staff was pleasant and the rooms were quiet (even though they had an event on the 2nd floor) and the beds were comfortable.  Although the hotel was moderately full, I never was woken up by someone flushing the toilet or coming in late at night.  The hot breakfast was unexpectedly very good, with a pancake maker, bread, bagels, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, oatmeal, bacon, eggs, sweet rolls, fruit, muffins, tea and very good coffee (and I am a coffee snob).  Although there isn't a restaurant onsite, the surrounding area has at least 3 major shopping malls within 2 miles radius with plenty of choices.  Compared

Stayed here 5 times now and we are from UK so that speaks volume  Good value - it's no Crowne Plaza but excellent value for money , nice King Suite Room , decent breakfast as great price  Not really much else to add  Thanks , see you next year.

This was one of the few hotels available near Disneyland, so I booked it for me and my family.  I probably won't be styting here again.  It wasn't too impressive.  I was in a non-smoking room, however, the room and bathroom smelled like someone was smoking.

Summary Heading: Had some problems with my 2nd stay
Summary: I was here in June 2012 and had room 102.  I left an extensive review earlier and was happy with my stay.  Came back again Oct 10-14, 2012 in room 116 and was so disappointed.  Do yourself a favor, do not stay in room 116.  It is right next to the pool area and great room where the continental breakfast is served.  Because the walls are super thin, you will hear every noise and conversation of anyone in the pool or the great room at all times!  I was unable to change my room during my stay so the quality of sleep those 4 nights was horrible.  The other reviews about the gaps around the door are true.  You will hear all noise and conversations of anyone who is in the hallway.  You will also hear the people above you.  It just sounds like people are stomping but I'm sure they are

The wife and I stayed here for three nights on our trip to Disneyland and I found everything to be in order. The room was clean, and the breakfast was good. Front desk employee Yolonda was very attentive on checking us in and Gus that worked swing shift was excellent in helping us find nice restaurants to eat at and even printed out maps so we could find them. Plently of parking and the shuttle to Disneyland leaves right out the front door and costs only $5.00 per person to get to and from Disneyland. We had a very enjoyable stay here at this Holiday Inn Express. Would stay here again.

We booked this hotel while visiting Disneyland. Figured it was far enough to avoid the crowds but close enough so we weren't driving a long distance when the park closed at midnight. The entrance of the hotel looked impressive but had a terrible smell, never quite figured out what it was. The hotel is in need of an update for sure! The heavy metal doors to the rooms had a 1-2 inch space that allowed the sounds of other rooms and the hallway traffic to keep you up all night long. I also appreciated the pile of mattresses, 10 high, stacked right outside our window...guess that may have something to do with the bed bug complaints in the earlier reviews. The pool and hot tub were okay, the pool was pretty chilly. The breakfast was mediocre and service was nothing to get excited

We stayed here for 3 nights and it was great!! The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly! The breakfast was great too! We were here on a visit to Disneyland which is not too far away. A Disneyland shuttle stops here every hour, and if you would like to use that it was not too pricey. I would definitely recommend this place. I'm not about the negative reviews because we had no issues. I guess if you expect the staff to get your luggage you would be disappointed, but really?? Come on.... ! Definitely worth the price and more!  Our next visit to Disney will also be our next stay here!
Manager Response: Wow, thank you for the great review on TripAdvisor! We're thrilled to hear you agree with our strong reviews from other guests.We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience and give our future guests a very clear explanation of all the great things that come with staying at the Holiday Inn Express & Suites Garden Grove. We're glad you had a good stay and hope to see you again very soon.

Summary Heading: Unprofessional staff rude and disgusting rooms
Summary: Me and my family stood there for 2 nights from an eight hr drive to go to Disneyland. We were so tired only to get nobody to help us with luggages or service they were rude and unprofessional. The breakfast was average. The rooms were disgusting as well old beds dirty and bad odors very uncomfortable. Stay at another holiday nba or any other hotel will be better then this one they give holiday inn hotels a bad name. They should take the Times to train people on customer service and housekeeping. Cause if there's no guests they have no jobs .

Summary Heading: Great base for Anaheim, Disney, and South LA
Summary: This is our second stay here and we were not disappointed. The hotel itself was very nice, clean and tidy and in a good location. The pool was excellent and the breakfast was standard HI Express - quite adequate and free!  The location is excellent, close to all local attractions, only 10-15 minutes from Disney and a little further to beaches.   Would definitely stay again.

Summary: I stayed at this property about 2 years ago when my family and i visited Disneyland. Considering that it's a Holiday Inn Express, and the price which we paid for the rooms, we weren't expecting much. We thought it'll just be a bedroom, a bed, and a bathroom. What we saw upon entering the room really surprised us, in a good way though. There were TWO queen size beds, a writing desk, a couch with an ottoman, and a TV. The bathroom has a tub, lots of towels, and a complete set of toiletries. The room was very clean, it smelled fresh, and beds were REALLY comfortable (especially after strolling around Mickey Mouse's kingdom for the entire day). They have a pool but we didn't get to try it as it was freezing outside. The stay also comes with breakfast. It wasn't much. Your typical

Summary: Booked a room through Hotels.com for a romantic getaway with my significant other for 8/17/2012 to 8/18/2012. At 3am on 8/18/2012 I'm awakened by screaming from my other half, she had woken up to pee and noticed a bug crawling on her arm. After turning on ALL the lights, I noticed she had bite marks (3 or more in a row) on her: wrist, arms, legs, shoulders, and ankle (picture attached). Immediately inspected the entire bed from pillows to floor, we found a total of 3 bugs (1 large, 2 smaller).
