Summary: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel because it wasn't within the Disneyland traffic however it still had a shuttle to the park. The rooms are very clean & the beakfast is very good. The greatest part about this hotel is the staff was so nice. We even missed our shuttle once & the man that was working the front desk called us a cab. We were always welcomed coming in & asked to have a nice day going out. I will most definitely stay here again my next trip to the area. Thank you to all the employees for such a wonderful stay.

Our room was clean,beds comfortable,everything worked in the room. Front desk greeted us every time we came in or left .They were also helpful in our requests. Nice and quite at night,over all a pleasant stay .
Manager Response: We can't tell you how much we appreciate you taking the time to share such an experience on TripAdvisor! The comments regarding the great customer service is very kind and we're thankful you had a great stay.

Summary: This is not a hotel that I would have normally booked.  However, I needed a room last minute in the area and this was one of the few choices available to me.  That being said, I was pleasantly surprised with the property.   The property was easy to find, centrally located, and I felt safe here.  This hotel is well maintained, very clean, and my room was rather large and nicely appointed.   For me the few negatives were issues that may not be all that big of a deal to other travelers.  The lack of black-out curtains bugged me because I am an East Coaster who is ready for bed before the sun sets here.  Not being able to black out the sun made it difficult for me to get as much sleep as I'd hoped for.  I could, however, have other ways to surmount this type of issue such as
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write this review and share your experience during your recent stay. We apologize for any inconveniences that you experienced during you stay with us, and we thank you for letting us know. Thank you for staying with us, and we look forward to welcoming you back as our guest.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, Convenient and Helpful Staff
Summary: This hotel was clean, staff was friendly and always accommodated any request.  We stayed for 10 days on a family vacation.  Room was just right for four people, but if more people there would be a space issue. Walls a little thin and mattresses need to be upgraded.  Very busy hotel due to its location.  Breakfast was standard, but employees constantly restocked items.  Best thing was the warm pool - by far the best we've ever been in at a Holiday Inn.  Recommend swimming during the day while kiddies are all at Disney.

Summary Heading: The best little Inn in Garden Grove
Summary: From the moment I walked in, I was truly captured by this place. Being a guy, I know we're not supposed to use words like terrific, cute and darling...but (oh well) this little Inn was terrific, cute and darling. Inside, just above the front desk, was a rounded balcony that had a bit of a castle look to it. It was warm, comfortable and, with all of the staff members being so kind, I felt safe and looked after. I noticed that I got a lot of smiles from the staff too---I'm not talking about some fake professional business type smiles, I'm talking about warm, genuine, friendly smiles from family oriented type professionals that gave you the impression that you had their attention. They would even chat a bit with you if you wanted and were always willing to go the extra mile to tend
Manager Response: We appreciate your amazing review! We know we are lucky to have so many great associates that choose to work at the hotel and are elated that they had a positive impact on your stay. We always tell potential new associates that you can't fake sincerity, so if you don't like helping people enjoy their vacation this isn't the hotel for you. We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit.

Summary: We sent two volleyball teams to participate in a tournament at the Anaheim Convention Center.  From the start, our sales rep, Erika Gomez, was a godsend!  She was thorough, always in communication, even covering details like "did we want breakfast earlier than advertised?".  The adults travelling raved about the staff, how friendly and accomodating they were.  The rooms were large and comfortable.  Overall, a tremendous experience with helpful, understanding staff.

I have a reservation of 5 days on this hotel for my friend visiting from Taiwan, I prepaid for the room with my credit card and they sold the room.  My friend's family arrive at the hotel after 16+ hr flight and no room.  I can't believe the hotel is so stupid.  What does reservation do if it can't hold the room.  I understand that they sell the room if I reserve for a day and I show up late, but I reserved the room for 5 days and paid for it.  They said they didn't charge me for the room, of course you didn't.  How can you charge me for something I didn't even get!!  Terrible, I will never stay at Holiday Inn EVER!!
Manager Response: Dear xbox409,  Thank you for your review regarding your experience at our hotel. It is regrettable you were not satisfied with the service you received. I would like to address this with you further. I have sent you a private message to obtain more information about your stay. I look forward to hearing from you and being of further assistance.  Sincerely,  Ferdinand G Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: My room was 102 and dates were May 30-Jun 3, 2012.  This room is away from the elevators (always noisy) and close to an exit where I can easily keep tabs on my vehicle. So unloading and packing was convenient.  The room size was perfect for a family of 4.  Rooms nicely cleaned, the beds were queens and the most comfortable I had ever slept in.  Bathroom was large.  The sink, vanity, shower, and toilet all encompasses this room.   No exhaust though at all in bathroom. So after 3 people showering, it gets very hot. The bathroom is next to the entry door so you have to prop something against the door to keep it open.  If you leave room, you have to shut the bathroom door.  (Construction was a bit awkward.)  Customer service was exceptional.  Breakfast had a pancake machine that was

Summary Heading: Now I Know Why They Are TripAdvisor Award Winners
Summary: My week long stay at HIEx in Garden Grove provided  me with one of my best business trips in recent memory.  First and most importantly, the staff here are **awesome**!  Jonathan, Gus and Adriana are the names I remember, and the other staff whose names I don't (apologies) all provided excellent customer service.  From recommendations to restaurants, a friendly "hello" on my way in or out, to basic hotel information, this team is TOP NOTCH!  Housekeeping staff?  Awesome.  Grounds and Maintenance Staff?  Very friendly and always busy.  Breakfast staff?  Sweet and helpful.    My room was super clean.  The bed and bedding is very comfortable.  Nice sitting area with love seat, chair and tables as well as a wet bar with fridge and microwave, cabinets stocked with basics like paper
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review of the hotel! We are excited to be your new favorite hotel in the Garden Grove area! We are so thrilled to hear how much you truly enjoyed your week long business trip, dining recommendations, and breakfast services. Your review is a continuous reminder to our staff of "what we are here for!" Thank you for staying with us, and we look forward to welcoming you back as our guest again!

Summary: This is a nice hotel that is far enough away from Disneyland that it is relaxing.  The rooms are clean and the hot breakfast was good.

I had a one night stay here. The room was extreemly spaceous and the bed was comfortable. There was a comfortable arm chair to sit in. The bathroom was average. The front dest staff were friendly and efficient. When checking out I I asked what was the brand of lotion supplied in the bathroom. The desk clerk told me what it was, where I could buy some more and he gave me another sample. Great service. Also I needed to print out some documents before leaving and there was a PC and printer ready and waiting for customers. The lift to the third floor, however is the slowest life I have ever used. If you can, take the stairs. Breakfast was great. Hot food plus, fruit, yoghurt and breads and cinnamon rolls. A great way to start the day. I would be very happy to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for pointing out all of the great things about our hotel! We value such detailed feedback from our guest on Tripadvisor.We pride ourselves to provide convenient amenities and services, as well as our friendly and welcoming staff.

Summary: Spent a few hours researching before our trip into Ca, was very pleased with our choice on this hotel with smiling faces to greet us and it's nice location. The rooms were very well furnished and bathrooms are very nice, it had everything we needed to make our stay very pleasant. The staff went above and beyond providing great customer service especially Gus. I had arrived for breakfast just a few minutes before it was open, Gus informed me it would be opened shortly, I told him that was fine I was just ready for coffee. I was very impressed when Gus came out with a cup of coffee for me, this in my opinion is a staff member who cares about his customers and is a great asset to Holiday Inn.
Manager Response: What an amazing review; thank you for taking the time to share this with the readers of TripAdvisor. Your experience is exactly what we strive for with each and every guest. We are very fortunate to have some talented people that genuinely care about our guests working here at the Holiday Inn Express Garden Grove. We hope to see you back for another visit later this year.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel but a couple of let downs
Summary: Just spent 2 nights here on my trip, 3rd Holiday Inn Express visited and this was the poorest of the 3 so far. The good points first! Easy to get to and in a decent location. The hotel looks great and its setting is nice. The people on reception were always very helpful and friendly. I used the heated pool and spa and it was great too. The breakfast again was standard for an Express and again did the job for us. Now onto the bad points. The beds here were way too soft and one of us had a sore back after the second day. I noticed you could hear more from the rooms around you and outside in the corridors. Also, the free wifi here was like glue, it was so frustrating.
Manager Response: scotsman2011,  Thank you for taking time out of your busy day to leave us a candid review.  We appreciate the candid feedback we receive and welcome any opportunity to improve.  While we understand that your stay was not 100% satisfactory, we would hope that you would give us another chance to make your stay as best as it can be.   Ben J IHG Care

Summary: Nice hotel near Little Saigon and close to highway.  Good in price, hot and tasty free breakfast included.  Good Service, staffs are nice.  Just a bit noisy from the next room.

I chose this hotel to stay at during our most recent trip to SoCal and we stayed for 3 nights. We were in town to celebrate my daughter's 16th b-day with shopping and Disneyland. From the second we walked in, we felt very welcomed and while we were checking in, we had a great chat with Jonathan and Gus (Front Desk). While we visit this area multiple times per year, Jonathan shared with us some great things to do that we haven't experienced in the past, such as trying the off the menu Mac & Cheese Pizza (KILLER!) at Newport Brew Co and the *FREE* balloon ride at OC Great Park (http://www.ocgp.org/visit/balloon/).   Later on the first evening, Gus went above and beyond his duties to secure us a mini-fridge for our room, as my daughter has some meds that need to be kept
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us! We take pride in our hotel as we strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations. We look forward to your future visit!

Summary: Took my 2 kids to Disney .great service,clean,free wi-fi ,breakfast and parking,really close to Disney without the crowds .i really recommend and thank all for you past reviews.the staff was great and hotel is nice.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write this review and share your experience during your recent stay. Thank you for noting some of the amenities at our property that separate us from the rest of the hotels in the area.

Summary: I brought my all-star soccer team to the Holiday Inn Express Hotel for a soccer tournament in the area. Many of my players had not traveled for sports before and were really excited for this trip.  The holiday inn staff was extremely helpful and accommodating (Especially Gus) and helped make this a fun and memorable trip for the families.  The Hotel was clean with plenty of parking and easy access to freeways.  I would for sure bring my team here again!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review! We are very happy to hear our hotel meets all your needs and that you have a great stay. Thank you for highlighting the great value of our ability to accommodate teams and spacious parking area. We thank you for staying with us. We look forward to your future visit!

Summary: To whom it may concern:   I Barbara Gaines stayed at your Garden Grove Location on the 11th with my family. It was the perfect loctaion for us all as it was in the middle of where all our friends and family were so made it easy for us to visit. Also Gus the desk clerk was very polite and helpful. We have have stayed in other Holiday Inns as well and we will be returning on our next visit for sure. I would have liked it if you allowed small to med dogs though as at times I do travel with them and have a hard time finding a decent hotel to stay at. Please tell Gus we thank him for all his help and kindness to us all. Thank you and God bless, Barbara Gaines  bgaines67@hotmail.com
Manager Response: Your comments are greatly appreciated. We are glad you were satisfied with the staff's service. We thank you for your concerns regarding our pet policy. We are more than happy to recommend local animal housing for your future visit . We find that because of these reasons our hotel has the most value as one of the Top 10 hotels on TripAdvisor. We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel and we hope to see you again, when your travels bring you back to the area!

Summary: This Holiday Inn Express is a very pretty property, well maintained, with good comfortable beds, plenty of hot water, and accommodating staff.  Breakfast was good for what it was, but the only fruit was bananas and it would have been nice to have oatmeal for a healthier choice.  Very small complaint, I would stay there again.  There is a shuttle to take you to Disneyland.  It is $4 round trip and you need to contact the hotel a half an hour ahead of time to let them know you are ready to come back.  We walked to Disneyland from the hotel, it took us 45  minutes and we felt safe the entire way.  Coming back at night, we were tired and hopped on the Orange County Bus right outside the main gate of Disneyland.  Bus #43 goes straight down Harbor Blvd and stops at Garden Grove Blvd.

Upon arriving, we were very impressed by the lovely landscaping and cleanliness of the front of the hotel and the lobby area.    Had an easy check in, lovely staff at the front desk.  We had a room on the main floor, our window looking out at the pool area.  Room was large and clean.  The only drawback was no fridge or micro.  Otherwise, everything we needed.  The breakfast every morning was very good, the staff were good at refilling everything as it would run out.  Nice to not have to pay for a huge breakfast when you do not want one.    Cleaning staff were friendly and our room was done up every day, plenty of towels and hot water to shower.    The pool was nice, but they should have a staff member to tell people who do not abide by the rules to do so, or leave the pool area.

Summary Heading: Great staff, good rooms, breakfast and pool were only downfalls
Summary: Staff upon check in was fabulous! We arrived early and they tried to accomadate us, but could not, so instead held all of our luggage so we could head to the parks.  Rooms were spacious and comfortable.  No concerns at all! Location cannot be beat - a 10 minute drive to the Disneyland parking lot.   Price was good. Breakfast - on Sunday it was fantastic: English Muffins, milk, yogurt, and much more.  After Sunday it was Carbs only! No yogurt, no milk, just pancakes, toast, biscuits and gravy.  Very disappointing!!! Pool was closed :( Disappointing, but it happens.
Manager Response: Your comments are greatly appreciated. We are glad you were satisfied with the staff's service. We thank you for your concerns regarding our breakfast options. We will look further into how we can improve our options of  our breakfast. Thank you for mentioning how spacious are rooms are, and the conveinenece of travel  between the hotel and Disneyland. I do apologizes for the inconveince of the pool closure during your stay.  We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel and we hope to see you again, when your travels bring you back to the area!

Summary Heading: Small but very nice and convenient.
Summary: I stayed at HIEGG for 3 nights during my vacation to Anaheim. I decided to give this hotel a try because it had an excellent rate. The room I stayed at was located on the first floor right in front of the lounge where they serve the complimentary breakfast and it was roomy and very nice. Seems like this hotel gets a lot of groups of children that go to Disneyland and there were lots of them everywhere, which I appreciated, since the hotel is really a quiet place. They have the shuttle that takes you to Disneyland, and you can buy a daily pass, the drive is not long and you can see a little bit of Anaheim on your way there. I'd definitely stay here once again! We met Cristina, the sales manager and she was very friendly and helpful.

Stayed here from Friday January 13th to Tuesday the 17th. Good service. For about half the rate of Marriott Courtyard you get free WiFi, and free breakfast. I am amazed that the higher priced hotels, including Marriott charge for these things. WiFi was a little slow, but not bad. The room was clean and comfortable. The place is quiet at night and my sleep was uninterrupted. The staff was friendly. No issues at all while staying here. Had all the hot water I needed. It is a great place to stay for a very reasonable price.

Summary Heading: DO NOT STAY NO HOT WATER
Summary: We paid in advance through Orbitz from December 25th - 31st and there was no hot water the entire stay. They do not have enough pressure when they are at capacity. They offered only some Holiday Inn Points and nothing else.  No return calls from the General manager... It is a low price but with no hot water ANYWHERE is better!

We stayed at this hotel right before Christmas for a Disneyland visit. We have stayed at many hotels in the Anaheim area, and I did appreciate the lack of Disneyland craziness that occurs at the hotels in the Harbor/Katella area. The drive to Disney is not very long, and I it seemed a bit less "tired" than many of the hotels nearer Disneyland. I do have some complaints, however. We have stayed at quite a few Holiday Inn Express locations around the western U.S. and all of the rooms were equipped with a mini-refrigerator. We reserved a regular double queen room and were surprised there was no mini-fridge. When we asked the front desk about this they said we could upgrade to a "suite" for $10 a night, which we did. The term "suite" meant that the room was perhaps a foot longer
Really nice hotel in good location.  Good Internet, and STD HI Xpress breakfast.

what a dump. Stayed here because of free night from priority points, only 15k points instead of 25k from other holiday inn around the area. The lobby was ok and the rooms are somewhat ok, the bed and tv are new, the bathrooms are old and moldy, the coffee maker was so small and the hallway carpets are disgusting.  It could be just because I stayed in nicer updated hotels in this trip and I only stayed here for one night so I might be just comparing this place from where I stayed at. They have a free breakfast and that was nice, lots of good selection. It's 5-10 mins drive to disneyland but they charge $4 per person for the shuttle. I stayed at the holiday inn buena park before and they don't charge for their shuttle and it's a longer drive even. I find the staff nice and did not

I enjoyed my stay from when I arrived until the day of my departure.  Excellent staff who do care about their guests and would go that extra mile to have them come back.  I would definitely come back since I travel quite often for business.  The bed was really comfortable, and the room was very cleaned upon arriving. I recommend this hotel if anyone is staying in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.

I recently stayed at this hotel for the third time. It gets better each time. The management has been busy upgrading the facilities. The furnishings are tastefully done.  I will continue to come back here. It is a great value for this area.

This hotel is one of my secret gems. Without exception, whenever I have work assignments in the Santa Ana, Anaheim, or Tustin area, this is where I stay. Great location, clean rooms, wonderful staff, & a great value compared to other hotels in the area. I recently suggested it to some friends planning a trip to Disneyland &a they loved it too. A shuttle to D-land is a nice plus when you have young kids in tow.

Summary Heading: Great value for conventions or longer stays
Summary: We stayed here for four nights for Blizzcon. I was looking for a hotel that had more reasonable prices and amenities than the others right across from the convention center and we found it! Plusses: smoking rooms, free wifi, free breakfast, heated pool/outdoor jacuzzi, mini-fridge and microwave in room, coin-op laundry downstairs. They run a shuttle service that runs only during Disney hours. If you're going to the convention center you may end up sharing with the people going to Disney but it's a short ride. The shuttle driver was a very nice, helpful guy.   Breakfast was awesome: eggs, bacon, bagels, pancakes, coffee, cereal, juice - you name it. The one tiny gripe I have was that one day they replaced bacon with sausage (yuck) and replaced the super yummy scrambled eggs with

Summary Heading: Used to be a good place to stay
Summary: I've stayed at this hotel several times and it's been adequate in the past.  This last stay was not a good experience.  The wireless internet does not work well (not good for business travelers).  The young, inexperienced team at the front desk will try to explain why you don't know how to connect to wireless even though you've done it hundreds of times with no problem.  Despite my insistence, they wanted to wait until the end of my stay to correct the credit card the stay would be billed to.  This was totally mishandled resulting in multiple holds against my card, and an eventual denial of my card.  The manager never followed back up with me as promised to correct the problem either.  I will not stay at this location on my future trips to the area.

The hotel itself wasn't too bad.  Maybe showing a little of it's age but otherwise okay.  But their reservation system stinks.  Stay there if you want but don't count on getting the room you reserved and paid for in advance.  In April 2011 I reserved and prepaid for a King Bed Suite Nonsmoking at a very good rate.  When we arrived at 4pm, August 6th they tried to book us into a smoking room.  The perfume they used is sickening and doesn't really mask the smoke.  Then they admitted they didn't have any non-smoking suites left so they booked us in a non-smoking king room and in a couple days they brought us a fridge after I had purchased an ice chest. I stay at this hotel last week for two night, I was there before february last year; my stay  the first day was very good. I agree with 00zyankee... review 100% about priority club member.  They don't care about membership even we are Platinum member, no upgrade, reserve the room for 3 adults, gave King bedroom, ask to 2 queen bedroom upgrade since we can sleep 3 people. Answer was no, cost money, don't care about member since we used points. No policy said about it. Talked with manager same answer no.  I wrote to Holiday Inn customer service, they request manager or owner to reply the matter in 48 hours, never hear from them.  Holiday Inn gave us 5000 points to compensate for this.

I was there during the first week of the month for 3 days and I can say I was not disappointed at all. Everyone was really friendly from the front desk staff to the housekeeping maids. The location is really convenient since there are plenty of things to do around that area and it's about 2.5 miles away from the Disney district. I would definately come back to this hotel.

Just what I expected...I travel 200 days a year on average, and this was my first visit to this property. Clean rooms, nice staff,and breakfast. All I needed to get me back on the road to my next destination. I would like to return for more leisure time in the future.

We stayed at this hotel for three nights. Here are the good and the bad points;  The Good;  The staff that we dealt with were all excellent but especially Po, our shuttle driver for two days. From the beginning he made us feel special (he even brought us a pastry!) and gave us lots of useful tips about the area and was so much more than the standard hotel shuttle driver.   There is free internet and  breakfast.  The Bad;  Despite the great shuttle service the fact that the hotel is too far to walk to any bars and restaurants is a huge minus.  The property as a whole looked very outdated. The carpets were worn, the doors were scuffed, and our door didn't quite fit properly in the frame.  We had paid extra for a "suite" but this consisted of just a fridge and a microwave with no

I reserved a simple king bed, didn't really expected much, just a comfortable bed and peaceful stay as I travel constantly. When I got to the hotel there was nobody to help me check in. After ten minutes a girl came to the front desk and simply asked me for my credit card. I asked for my upgraded room she said "you don't get one". Then realized my priority club number wasn't listed, but I was too tired and it had been a long day to argue.  My disappointment was not only this but around 10pm someone walked into my room. Well, it was what I expected from the express version: - Clean room - Simple breakfast - Available printer  The price was a bit high for the quality but in proportion to the other hotels in the area.  Will come back if needed.

Upon entering after 9pm we wer greated with a smile and friendly face. We added an extra night onto our prior reservation and had to stay in a smoking room but the room didn't smell that badly. The hotel is very clean and very polite staff. The Breakfast area smelled great, clean and kept organized. Their outdoor heated pool is great, feels like a warm bathtub when getting in. The water was a little warm but for my little she had a blast especially since the water was warmer. The only pit fall to the hotel was that we were placed next to the Fitness Center and every time some one was on the treadmill we would toss and turn until the machine stopped. Excellet hotel for our money and our wonderful Disneyland trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. All of your great compliments will be shared with our staff and department managers. Summary Heading: not up to Holiday Inn Express standards
Summary: As I have said before my husband travels for work, and I get to tag along for company.  This trip my husband had asked for an early check in of 11:30 (mind you he has Platinum Elite Priority) We got to Orange County a little early and he called to ask if the room was ready,it was 11:15, and was told it would be a hour.  ok we could get lunch before his meeting, drop me by the hotel and he be on his way.  No such luck.  at 12:15, we called again to check on our room that was suppose to be ready at 11:30, and was told it would be another hour....We finally checked in, and the rooms were clean, just old.  Old tvs, hair dryers, ect. the wireless internet would not hook up at all.   I guess the final straw was all the kids in the pool after 10:00pm.. That is quite time.  The staff

I stayed here with friends over spring break for 3 nights and we immensely enjoyed our stay.  The outdoor pool was awesome, as was the complimentary breakfast in the morning.  Parking was ample and we were within walking distance (a little over a mile) of Disneyland.  A huge shopping mall and movie theater were also located a short drive away.  If I'm ever in this area again, I would most definitely stay here!

My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel on Saturday 18th of June to go to the U2 concert in Anaheim. I booked at Priceline and named my own price for this area and got this hotel for a good deal.  Check in was easy and fast. Front desk staff was very friendly. Wireless worked great and was free as was parking and breakfast.  Room was nice and spacious with comfortable bed. Bathroom was super clean and big. We were on the third (highest) floor. Rooms seem to be well insulated, since we did not hear people in other rooms. Breakfast was good with a small self serve Coffee, O.J. , Yogurt, Cereal, Toast, small omelets  Better than just your regular "Continental Breakfast". We had an early dinner at the Thai Restaurant only about 2 blocks away. Food was great. Cab came soon after we

Summary Heading: Nice stay I had with my family
Summary: Nice clean, well maintained hotel. Very close to Disney world less than 10 min by car. Right next to the highway.  Free breakfast with hot pancakes, scramble eggs, etc. Also room rate was cheap, compared to others.

I haven't stayed here yet, but I wanted to share the information I received via email as of 5/24/11 from the staff about the shuttle. Apparently, it is not complimentary. =[    Thank you for considering our hotel. We do have shuttle service and we work exclusively with a cab company. We charge $4.00 for Adult and $1.00 for Children. This pass is an ALL DAY pass. You can come and go as many times as you need to. The shuttle comes per your request however, you do need to give us notice 30 minutes in advance. They usually come every 30 minutes for example, 9:30, 10:00, 10:30 etcâ€¦ Please let me know if you have any further questions.   Kind Regards, Karla Luna Sales Associate Holiday Inn Express & Suites Garden Grove

We stayed at HI express for 5 nights.  Rooms clean and beds comfy.  Breakfast great & breakfast staff so kind!  Quiet at night and quick drive to Disneyland.   Only negative was pool was closed for repairs.  Pool huge with kids.  Good reminder to check with hotel/motel before booking regarding pool.  Friendly staff!  Would definitely stay again!

We stayed here for 3 days and we love this hotel.  It's location is closed to everything. shopping, both Longbeach and John wayne airport and specially it is closed to all the restaurants that I love.  The bed is so comfortable, room is always clean and neat when we come back in the evening.  Breakfast is excellent and it is free; parking is also free (Other hotels in the area charges $12 to $15 for parking) .  We only had 2 breakfast since we have to leave very early the last day.  Breakfast includes hot pancake, scramble eggs, bacon, sausages and cinamon rolls and more........ I highly recomend this hotel to anyone who visits Disney area or staying in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Superb, clean, bright and cheerful, with very helpful staff
Summary: I stayed here for a month. The staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful.  I had stayed here several times before and was not as impressed as this time.  The management has been working very diligently to upgrade the property. There was a lot of painting, cleaning and renovating going on.  As a result the place gives a much better impression. I didn't experience any of the noise problems other people have posted about. My impression was overal very good.

It was Spring Break so even though I was really sick, I was determined to go with my family to Disneyland.  We checked-in to the hotel and I didn't step foot outside of our room until we checked-out 4 days later.  I was miserable, but the hotel staff was amazing.  The Front Desk Staff (Rita and John) were incredibly helpful to me and my family and always genuinely concerned about me.  Rosa, our House Keeping lady, while cleaning our room around me, called a friend to ask about a home remedy for me.  The thoughtfulness doesn't stop there, the hotel Manager, Christina Lopez, was equally amazing.  She did everything she could to make sure we had the best stay possible.  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who plans to stay in the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Thanks TripAdvisor Reviewers this was a good find!
Summary: Based our decision to book here on all these reviews and yes it was a good find. Lobby was beautiful! Room was small but nice and clean. Pool was very warm and also clean. We spent the day swimming with the kids at the pool because of the Tsunami warning at the beach. Breakfast was yummy, we ate there for 3 days and they offered a nice variety of food including yummy cinnamon rolls. Staff were super friendly and kind to our children; finding and warming milk for my 2 year old's sippy cup. Just a few miles from Disney and close to a Target and lot of restaurants. It is too far to walk to Disney but they do offer a shuttle service. We had a car so we just drove. We will stay here again...I think we only paid about $80 a night....but it's clean and safe and just what we needed for

We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Garden Grove for a week in March 2011 on a family trip to Disneyland. In the past we have stayed closer to the park, but we will definitely being staying here our next visit. It is nice to be  away from the crowds of the park, but still a close enough to get to the park easily and quickly in the morning. It was quiet and relaxing. The pool was wonderful. The staff were friendly. The breakfasts supplied a variety of suitable choice.

We stayed here for our 1st Disneyland Christmas vacation. It was very comfortable and the atmosphere was quite nice. When we first approached we were surprised with how beautiful and well kept the exterior of the hotel and landscaping was. We stayed for 3 nights and had an adequate, filling breakfast every morning. All the employees were courteous and helpful. We would stay again just for the convenience of having a personal shuttle service to that took us to Disneyland. All we had to do was inform the front desk we needed the shuttle and they were there within 20 minutes. That gave us enough time to have breakfast and be off. When we were ready to leave Disneyland, we made a phone call again and the shuttle service was there within 15 minutes, WOW, we were really pleased. We

Summary Heading: Good Value But Not as Nice as Other Holiday Inn Express Stays
Summary: The price is right, but this Holiday Inn Express is not as good as other Holiday Inn Express's I've stayed with.  The sound dampening is non-existent.  You hear everything in the halls, from the street, and the adjacent rooms.  Room is clean.  Bed is comfortable.  No cinnamon rolls at breakfast.  A gentleman asked for some the first morning I was there.  One tray of 6 was brought out.  The man's family took them all and no more were brought out.  Day 2 of stay, no cinnamon rolls at all, just pre-packaged pastries.  The rest of the breakfast was fair.  The scrambled eggs are mushy and bland.  Not sure how often the hallways are vacuumed as a large dead plant leaf laid in the same place on the third floor for 3 days.  Free wired and wireless internet works fine, but I had to call

Summary Heading: Great hotel on a budget, wonderful location.
Summary: Just returned this evening from this hotel. Highly recommend staying here if you are looking to stay in Orange County. Clean, friendly staff, nice rooms, nice breakfast. Close to everything, right off the 22 Freeway. 15 minutes to John Wayne Airport. Malls close by. 25 minutes to Huntington Beach. Nice hot breakfast, OJ was the best! Pool was very warm so was hot tub. Room was extremely clean, bed comfortable enough. No complaints. Two of us stayed in a double bed room, plenty of space. Message me if you have any questions!

We have stayed at Holiday Inn Express Garden Grove for  7 years running.  We bring a large group of High School Students, every spring.   We have had late PO's and the  Manager was so easy to work with!   They have always taken such great care of us!!  It would be hard to find to another hotel to get the same amount of care and service that the Manager and her staff have always given us.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, great staff, early breakfast
Summary: I've stayed here before and really enjoy this location near where I needed to go in Santa Ana.  Great staff, breakfast was set up early--very nice as I had to leave early.  Staff let me check in early, which was extremely helpful.  I've always had an excellent experience at this Holiday Inn Express.  The price ($20 more than a budget hotel is very reasonable.    I'll be back!

We stayed here for 2 nights last week. Check in was quick and the staff was helpful. The rooms were new and clean. The free internet access was good. Very nice and well maintained. But the free hot breakfast was not the best yet it was decent.  Overall it was a great stay.

Summary Heading: Perfect location, great services and very friendly staff
Summary: My family stayed here in August 5th for 3 nights, we were very pleased with the staff, the girl that checked us into our room was very helpful, she made us feel very comfortable like we're at home. She provided us a list of all the restaurants in the area and the direction to disneyland., the malls, etc..The room was very clean, the bed was comfortable and the breakfast was excellent.. I had a very pleasant stay and i would definitely come back again and also i would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

It was located at a quiet area, & a few mins drive to Crystal Cathedral, Discovery Centre, Disneyland, Target's, Costco. Lots of parking. I was thinking Holiday Inn Express is the cheaper version of Holiday Inn, but yet it still does retain the elegance & cleanliness surprisingly.  I pre-booked a non smoking room, but was still given a smoking room meant for handicaps. Since it was a larger room, I had no complaints. I opened the windows & door for a couple hours to let fresh air in. The room was neat & clean. Free internet access was pretty fast.  Breakfast dining area was a little small yet cozy. Breakfast provided was basic but quite good. The yoghurt ran out so quickly!! Urgh!!  Overall, a pleasant stay =)

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and excellent location
Summary: Great place to stay. The room was big and clean and the bathroom was large enough and updated. The breakfasts were very good. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was close to the places I wanted  to visit with my family. I will stay there again and highly recommend it for those who are looking for the reasonably priced hotel offering good quality of staying.

Summary Heading: WORST MANAGEMENT IN ALL THE HOTELS WE'VE STAYED IN
Summary: Do not make a prepaid reservation at this hotel.  My family  prepaid two rooms here.  Our flight was canceled and re-scheduled the following day.  As soon as we were notified by the airline, which was the day before, we immediately contacted the hotel and advised them of our late arrival.  We had paid for a room with 2 beds.  When we arrived at the hotel, they gave away our room.  My kids had to sleep on the sofa chair and we were not re-imbursed for our prepayment of the room with two beds.  The General Manager Christina Lopez was so difficult to communicate with.  She seems to have not taken any courses on tourism.  She told us to "shut up"  when we were trying to request for the room we pre-paid for.   They were duly informed of our late arrival, they already took the money
Manager Response: The Holiday Inn Express Garden Grove strives in providing excellent customer service; although Posing as a Guest is not adequate in this forum; I would like reiterate that the Holiday Inn Express learned about guest's flight delay and gladly provided accommodations to Complimentary Jr. Suite Upgrades throughout the stay.    TripAdvisor is a greatly respected entity, therefore all opinions are valid and respected. Though our resolution did not provide compensation to your agency we took your email threats responsibly and we remain confident in stating that your contribution is not legitimate.   Our hotel understands that travel plans change on a regular basis and our highly trained staff is eager to find positive solutions within reasonable standards.   If you have additional questions regarding your billing and commission statements, please contact me at the hotel or email address you have on file.   Thank you.   Sincerely, Christina Lopez - GM Holiday Inn Express Garden Grove, CA

Summary: We had a very pleasant 3 night stay at this property at the beginning of our holiday.Arriving after a long flight and feeling tired, we were checked in very efficiently by friendly staff.The room was large and comfortable and as a priority club member the welcome basket of fruit and snacks was a nice touch! There was a good choice at breakfast, although we never saw any of the cinnamon rolls that we had seen at other holiday inn express breakfasts! Perhaps we were just unlucky! Overall a great hotel and we would return.

The Holiday Inn Express on Garden Grove Blvd is a very nice hotel. Very clean, very much up to date. Before booking, I wondered about the distance from Disneyland, but by automobile, Harbor Blvd is less than 2 minutes away and Disneyland itself is less than 10 minutes away. The hotel is located in a safe neighborhood.  There is a supermarket and places to eat less than 5 minutes away. The hotel itself is modern. They have a nice swimming pool. It is a heated swimming pool. The staff were very friendly and were always helpful.   They serve a free breakfast 7 days a week from approximately 6:30 am to 9:30 am. Breakfast was very good. Consists of scrambled eggs, bacon, toast/bread or English muffin if you desire. Pastries, muffins, 4 kinds of cold cereal, oatmeal. Fresh fruit such

I stayed there for the Memorial weekend. The staff is very friendly. Breakfast is good. Internet is fast and the signal is strong. Room is clean.  Only thing I complain here is the insulation of the walls. Our room was on the third floor next to the elevator.The walls seem too thin so that you can hear noises from the hallway and the adjacent rooms. I will not describe what happened in the adjacent room, you can figure it out. The noise from the hallway wouldn't be a problem if the tourists from Navolatour.com didn't hang around the elevator to have a conversation with their loud voice at midnight. If they don't put the chairs next to the elevator, I think those tourists won't sit there to talk.  I would come back there but will not pick room next to the elevator.

Summary Heading: Decent but could use some improvement
Summary: This hotel was very pretty good for the price, but it wasn't as wonderful as some of the reviews would lead you to believe. The hallways are a bit old and dark, there is only one elevator (we stood in line once behind a large group of people). Breakfast was standard- scrambled "eggs", biscuits, some sort of weird gravy, yogurt, and toast/bagels. It was in a small (crowded) room. Rooms could use a small facelift.

My family of 4 stayed here for 5 days for our Disneyland vacation, and let me tell you it was AWESOME! You can't beat the price you pay for the hotel, and the hotel pics don't do this hotel justice! Very nice,comfortable, great staff, awesome location. I am very picky about where we stay and was a little leary of staying here because it wasn't a 4 star hotel but I was very happy with our stay, and plan on going back this summer, and we WILL be staying here again. Close to Disney, and tons of places to eat, and a Target as well.

Love these guys! Got lost on my way to the convention center.. called up the front desk and they got me back on track! Hows that for service? It was nice being able to come back and lounge in the spa. Also enjoyed the proximity to all the big socal hotspots.

Summary Heading: Perfect for my business needs, will come back again.
Summary: I was in town recently for a training seminar. One of my colleagues recommended staying at this hotel as he had always received such great service here.  I took his advice and when I walked into the hotel, I was pleasantly surprised.  It smelled so fresh and the lobby was very nicely decorated. The front desk person was so friendly and greeted me with a smile. After that horrid plane trip, I just wanted to get to my room, but the girl at the front desk made my day by being polite and offering me a cookie that was on the counter.  I then went up to my room. It was clean and when I sat on the bed, the mattress was very soft, not like other hotels I've stayed at. I pulled out my laptop to get some work done and I saw a cable in the wall. I called the desk to ask if the internet was

Summary Heading: Best place I've ever stayed at.
Summary: the service was excellent, loved the restuarant was great really good food. pool and spa well maintained, family had a great time.

Summary Heading: Great place to rest after long Disney days.
Summary: Before we even stepped into the hotel the staff was great. Our GPS is an app on my phone & it was going dead 45 minutes away from the hotel. I called the front desk for directions from my husband's phone and they led us right in. They greeted us everytime we were coming & going. Even talked to our 3 kids (8,6,& 2) telling them to have a good time. Our room was nice & clean, but there are 5 of us, so it was cramped. We were only in the room to sleep & get ready for another day at the parks. We chose to pay less on the hotel and spend more at the parks. That being said, we never tried the hot breakfast since we ate all our meals at the park. The ART shuttle was great. Always on time & the front desk always new when the next shuttle was coming. We would def stay here again, just in

Before I booked this hotel, I read the reviews from many guests. I also checked out the other hotels within the immediate vicinity around Disneyland and decided this hotel will give us the best bang and experience for the money. Am I glad that I stayed here!  Contrary to some reviews, the front staff was friendly, cordial, and went above and beyond to accommodate all our requests. The room were clean. We did not see any ants and didn't not have any problems with the rooms. The breakfast changed every other day and for the price, it was well worth the money. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay here again next time we are in the area for a visit.

My wife and I were a little worried about going to this hotel after reading the last review but I would have to say the last reviewer couldnâ€™t have been any more wrong. After we have been traveling for the last week driving across country this hotel happened to be one of the cleanesnt and friendliest.  Everyone from the front desk and the housekeeping staff would say hi, every time we walked by. We ended up having an upgraded room even though we made our prepaid reservation thru Hotwire (which is a really cheap rate). The Hot Breakfast in the morning was nice and had plenty of items to choose from and the free internet to top it off. I would like to thank the staff for everything they did for my wife and I. Next time we come to California we know were we will be staying.   P.S.

Summary Heading: Horrible, Horrible, and Even Worse - Don't Stay Here!
Summary: We stayed in this hotel in two rooms. They had ants in the bathroom when we arrived. They were there the entire stay and because the floor was full and we had children in another room we could not be moved. They got into EVERYTHING, clothes, personal items, towels, everthing! The housekeeping new they were there and did nothing. They constanly turned off the air conditioning everyday so we came home to a hot, stufy room every night, late from Disneyland. It took until 3 in the morning to cool off and then you were cold all night. They opened the curtains every day just adding insult to injury and when we tried to speak to anyone other than the front desk while we were there, they did not speak English and would talk right in front of you in Spanish. When we tried to address all
Manager Response: Hotel appreciates your feedback. Our Corporate Custumer Service department provided a positive resolution.  It is important to us that we hear from our client's perspective and utilize each opportunity to improve our performance.  Thank you!

Summary: This place served its purpose, but is definitely not worth writing home about. It's quite pretty from the outside, and clean and comfortable on the inside, but in the case that I ever return to Garden Grove, I wouldn't hesitate to look elsewhere for a room.

I was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the hotel and room because the room rate so inexpensive.  Everyone at the front desk was very friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was fully stocked, hot and tasted good.  We drove our own car, so I do not now if there is a shuttle to Disneyland, but it is straight down the road just a couple of miles.  I would definitaly stay there again!  Great job staff in Garden Grove.
Hotel staff was very friendly. Very surprised to see how nice the room was. The breakfast was the best "continental" breakfast I've ever had. Definitely will stay again.

Summary Heading: Nice clean friendly hotel, with good breakfast and nice pool!
Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days. The rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable, The breakfast was decent, pool was a nice size and seldom busy. The location was good for us as we did not go to Disneyland this time, but we knew the area. I would recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: For the price I thought this place was good & clean!
Summary: I thought that this place was great for the price! When we got there in the late afternoon with our two impatient teenage daughters after a long drive fron Elk Grove, CA the room that they gave us was full of smoke smell (we dont smoke & requested a non smoking room) They young girl at the front desk got the manager Ruthie & she promptly gave us a new non-smoking room. The hotel was clean and quiet. We were there four nights M-F. We had a room with two queen beds & it had everything that we needed in it. It was clean and the maid service was good! They cleaned our room everyday. We took a shuttle on the 1st day to Disneyland as we all wanted to go at different times. You can get a shuttle pass for $4 at the front desk good for the whole day. Parking is free at this hotel. We all

Summary Heading: Our Getaway from Vegas to The Disneyland Area
Summary: So we found this hotel online once when my boyfriend and I where going to Disneyland for our 1 year anniversary. We found the hotel fine and we had a car so the area was convenient. Disney one way and the beach the other. Our room was in a corner so we had a nice view and the room was very nice. We actually had booked two rooms because my parents wanted me to have my own room, the room was never used although that room was very nice as-well.  We had a spare to moment trip and this time we brought my little sister along. After a whole day surfing and baking in the beach and an evening in Downtown Disney we didnt feel like driving back to Vegas that night, so we ended up back at this hotel and they had rooms and the price was reasonable. Once again, rooms where very nice and we

We stayed the required two nights for the free night promotion but were denied because we booked thru Orbitz!   My cousin and her husband stayed here as well when we attended my mother's funeral.  The hotel made out. Nowhere in the promotion did it mention this qualifier and I am no longer a loyal Priority Club member!

The manager of this hotel is terrible. She canceled our rooms a week before our trip. Our school PO was late getting there through no fault of our own. She said she'd give the check another week to get there but went back on her word 2 days later, even though our check reached her. Who would want to reserve rooms at a hotel with a power hungry, dishonest manager like this? We take students to CA every year and you can bet we will never give this hotel our money again. There are plenty of other great hotels in CA with honest managers who know how to keep business coming back year after year.  This manager also did this to another teacher at our school.

Staff is rude and unhelpful.  there are plenty of hotels in this area, do your self a favor and stay elsewhere.  Front Desk staff Andrea V. is extremely rude, would not allow us to have our seeing eye dog in our room, she wanted us to leave it in our car!!  extremely rude!!!  Hotel looks rather old, bathrooms not up to Holiday Inn standards!

Summary Heading: A Great Bang for the Buck!
Summary: First off let me introduce myself in saying I am a world traveller and have stayed at many hotel chains worldwide and this is NOT the first time I have been to LA. This hotel is an excellent choice for the money .Myself and sixteen year old daughter used this hotel for a home base while visiting the Los Angeles and  Disneyland area.The Hotel is about a ten minute drive to Disneyland, California adventure.Upon arrival we noticed how well maintained the grounds were for a small hotel (three levels high) The staff at the front desk were very friendly upon greeting us and very helpful with trying to answer questions.The rooms were of average hotel size (maybe a little larger than average)and the bathroom was a good size also with all the amenities you would need like a  coffee

Summary Heading: Not the best if thin walls are one of your pet peeves.
Summary: The hotel attendant greeted us politely when we checked in during the evening.  No qualms with the staff.  Breakfast included things such as sausages, biscuits, gravy, eggs, and cereal.  I know there were other items but those were what I honed in on.  There was also orange juice.  My 4 and 2 year old loved the breakfast.  Driving wise it wasn't too bad to get to Disneyland.  I'd say it took my family and I about 10 minutes or so to get there and I'm not a fast driver either.  My main gripe about this place is that the walls here are indeed paper thin.  The room next door to me had a cell phone alarm clock go off super early in the morning for the three mornings my family and I spent there.  It felt like the cell phone alarm clock was going off in my room instead.  This annoyed

The staff was unfriendly and not accommodating at all.  Requested adjoining rooms early and many times.  First told none available, then told could not get a king room & 2 queen rooms adjoining. Walls are paper thin and noisy. Worst of all, a cockroach was found in the bathroom at which time they did move us to another room.

Summary Heading: just okay..but, will not return to this hotel when visting Disney again.
Summary: I picked this hotel based on reviews on several travel websites for our first trip to Disneyland and I will not be booking this hotel again. We stayed for 4 nights. The hotel is okay. They serve breakfast every morning with eggs, sausage and biscuits and gravy, cereal and several pastries and breads, so that was okay. The omelets tasted like they were made with cheese wiz though. The fitness room just has a treadmill and bike. no weights. The jr california king room was okay, it had a sofa and chair and microwave and small refrigerator. the room was dusty, the air conditoner/heater made loud banging noises at many times of the night and the sofa bed was broken. We found a torn blanket in the dresser and the bed was very uncomfortable. The pool was heated, but dirty with bees,

I booked this hotel as I am a Priority Club member.  They had all our check-in papers ready when we arrived.  They were extremely friendly and gave us a room on the 2nd floor next to the elevator (neighbors only on one side).  We didn't hear any noise from the hall.  Room was clean.  Was great to have free wireless internet as we looked up quite a few things and Skyped home.  The washer and dryer in the laundry room took half-an-hour each so I was greatly impressed.  Pool and jacuzzi (no bubbles) were heated.  Hotel was conveniently located near to restaurants and near freeway. Saw a shuttle come by the hotel, but we had our own car. Even if you don't go to Disneyland, I recommend checking out Downtown Disney which is 12 minutes away.  It's free entrance (though you have to pay

My boyfriend and I stayed here after seeing good reviews on this website and others. We both really loved it. The people behind the desk were so friendly and helpful, it was in a very central location for what we needed, and it was very clean and bright. We thought the breakfast was pretty good, too. We were thoroughly impressed and would definitely stay here again.

My family and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Garden Grove for one night, August 30-31st. Check in was fast and easy and the front desk associates were very nice. The lobby is beautiful. We had two queen room suites which were very big and spacious. We were in rooms 106 and 107 right accross from each other and close by the parking lot. We did not hear any noise in our rooms from the streets or the freeways. Some of the people staying next to us were loud in the morning but nothing too bad. You couldn't really hear them until they were in the hall. The beds were really comfortable and so was the bedding. It felt like we were sleeping on clouds. The internet did not work right away when we first got in our rooms. We called the tech support team and it was a wide spread issue

very nice motel very new looking, nice pool, basic continental the hot breakfast isnt worth going for, which sold us on the place, stayed 8 night for 56 dollars a night through getaway today, constant ant problem, motel staff were unhelpful with moving us to another room during morning or evening, which leads me to the reason we wont go back the transit took 15 min to get you to disneyland but 40 min to 1 hour to get you back, i called the motel staff before going on the trip and they said 15 min to disneyland. I guess i should of asked how far back but I think if they would of been up front about it and told me i wouldnt be a little disgruntled but i guess that self preservation on there part so heres my warning dont take the aneheim resort transit, drive instead

Summary Heading: Would stay again and recommend to others!
Summary: This was a great place to stay while spending a couple of days at Disney. The room was clean and everything was in working condition. It is a couple of miles from Disney and we chose to drive and park there. The breakfast was decent in the morning. I would recommend this hotel to anyone inquiring.

The Hotel staff are friendly. The room was clean. Breakfast was OK but not as good as some. Pool was small but heated and clean. Now the problem. Don't know if it was just our room or not but you can hear every toilet flush, door bang, foot step and the gardener is up early, very early. If you are getting up at 5:30 - 6:00 then your OK but if you want to get up later you will get disturbed. We cut our stay short and moved on a day early because of the noise.

Our family has stayed at this hotel 5 times in the last 2 years. If you are looking for a CLEAN hotel, with GREAT service, really decent FREE breakfast near Disneyland, you need to stay here. It is never too crowded. The pool is great for kids. You're about 4 miles from Disney, but we have annual passes and get free parking, so that has never been a problem for us (who wants to walk back to a hotel after 12+ hours of walking around the parks all day anyways?) The bathrooms are really nice, you don't get black feet walking barefoot on the carpet (like some other supposedly nice hotels nearby), and the beds are very comfortable. We love it so much, we are going again this fall.

Stayed here for 4 nights in May 2008.  Booked this hotel to be near Disneyland.  It was an average hotel and probably worth what we paid given the proximity to Disney.  Free breakfast was OK, and room was clean and comfortable.  Not an exceptional hotel, but adequate for the price paid.

This hotel ONLY guarantees smoking preference, not room type (2 double beds, suite, executive, etc.).  I booked online through their direct website and reserved a Non-Smoking King Bed Suite, which has a fridge and microwave. The rate was called Advance Purchase which means I had to pay the full amount at the time that I made the reservation, which I thought was fine because it was a great price. When we checked in at the hotel, the front desk person told me they didnâ€™t have any suites left and gave me a room with 2 double beds and NO fridge or microwave. We get to the room and it smelled so bad. We realized they put us in a smoking room. I thought that was pretty inconsiderate since my toddler was right there when we checked in. We went back to the front and asked if there was

Summary Heading: Holyday Inn Express Garden Grove can improve
Summary: In last december I went to Disneyland and I booked at Holiday Inn Express Garden Grove, the hotel is nice but It could be better. When we arrived to LA we rent a car and drived to Garden Grove area, we made a mistake and we arrived to Holiday Inn at Katella, the Front Desk person was really nice,she offered us a cup of coffee and explained with calm how arrived to the correct hotel.  What a surprise when we arrived to the correct Holiday Inn, the coffee area was a mass, everything was dirty, broken or out off place, the front desk recepcionist was so agressive, the day was so cold, she wouldnÂ´t give us other blanket, my mother got a flu, until the waitress got to clean the room, and found my sick mother there, she help us, with a decent blanket. At night you could find, the

We booked this hotel because of all the good reviews from Trip Advisor. I must say that most of the reviews were dead on. The hotel staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. Check in was quick and easy. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The free breakfast that they offer is small but very good. It is very nice of them to offer this service - especially if you are in a hurry to get to Disneyland in the morning. All amenities were only about a block away. Plenty of food places and even a Target. Disneyland was an easy eight minute drive up the road. My only slight dislike is that the walls are very thin. You can hear conversations going on outside in the parking lot and you can hear the water running in the shower and toilets being flushed in the room next store. Other than

We stayed here for 3 nights in March. We wanted to be close to Disneyland, but booked too late for a closer hotel.  Check in was quick and the staff was helpful. The rooms were very new and clean. The free breakfast was very disappointing. The pastries  and muffins were small and bland. Everything was standard cold breakfast food. We ended up eating out the other mornings. The shuttle that ran to Disneyland only ran  on the half hours. We opted for a taxi as it was the same rate for 4 of us as the shuttle with no stopping at other hotels. The free internet access in lobby was helpful. Very nice and well maintained. .  Great stay.

Great hotel. Wanted hotel near Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm without the locality premium. Also wanted a safe and clean spot for a good price. We were traveling with a friend who is in a wheelchair. Cannot say enough about this place. It was clean. It was new. The location was perfect (just outside of premium area but close enough that it was not a long haul). Staff was friendly and helpful. I don't understand comments about surrounding area being a rough neighborhood. It looked like typical California city center to me. The area was busy but not run down. The city in this area is a little old, but most of this area around Disneyland was built in the 40's and 50's.  I would strongly recommend this place for those looking for a clean spot, close to Disneyland and looking for a

Summary Heading: Not far from Disneyland!  Nice Place!
Summary: This place is clean and close to Disneyland. (Just a few blocks away)  It was perfect for the price we paid.  Pool is nice.  I would recommend it if you aren't worried about being right next to Disneyland.  It seemed to have easy access to The Block shopping center, and other stores like Target, etc.

Summary Heading: Questionable area; too far from parks
Summary: Our family is a fan of Holiday Inn Express properties and from the photos of this one found on the company's website, as well as reviews from this site, this one seemed to be a winner.   It was fine -- mostly clean, relatively new, friendly staff, decent free breakfast. A few minor glitches: For some reason, the microwave and mini-fridge we've enjoyed at other HIE properties was not supplied here. Also, we couldn't get the temperature in the room right, due to the tempermental AC unit -- sometimes too cold, other times too hot, and the fan wouldn't stay on when we wanted it to. The bathroom door is on a hinge that automatically closes behind you, making it tough to keep an eye on the kids while you're in there. We called for extra towels and had them delivered -- twice, by two

The hotel is small but wonderful inside. Everything is new/clean. The lobby looks fancy.   I am at the hotel right now. I am here with my son so that we can go to Disneyland, which is only 4 miles away. We have booked one of the suites and it is awesome. It is really large and has a balcony. There is high speed internet in the room (not wireless but cable), refrigerator, microwave, etc. I think that holiday inn must have VERY recently bought this hotel and updated everything (furniture, paint, etc.. are all new). The things that I did not like include the lack of a dvd player in the room (I have a 4 year old who likes his disney movies) and that there are only 2 beverage vending machines in the place, one of which has water. The vending machine was out of water and we are not

My family stayed here when we went to Disneyland in April.  We were very pleased with the staff and the room was clean and comfortable.  The staff was great about looking after anything you needed.  The continental breakfast was pretty good, although I have had better.  The only complaint I have was that it was a bit of a distance from Disneyland and the shuttle only ran every hour.  If you missed your shuttle, you had to wait a whole hour for the next one.  This also made going back to the hotel for a rest not as convenient.  Overall though we had a great time and would definitely recommend this hotel.

I stayed here Apr. 29 in order to go to Disneyland and California Adventure with my two daughters.  It is close and convenient.  I chose it because my choices were limited due to booking a week ahead of time.  I paid $99 and it was worth it.  The room was clean and fulfilled its purpose.  The breakfast was just ok.  They had soft boiled eggs, muffins, small danishes and apples.  There was assortment of juices and a few cereals.  It was really crowded in there so I took the food up to our room.  Check- in was very quick and the employees were all extremely friendly.  The only negative was that housekeeping came to our room at 8:45 AM morning of check-out.  Fortunately, we were headed out to the parks, but if we weren't, I would have been a little annoyed.  Usually hotels give you

The room was clean , and the shuttle to Disneyland was a plus. They had a nice breakfast in the morning. The pool and hot tub area were nice. The fitness room was small, but was always empty so who cares. You could still get a workout. The staff were nice with fast check in/out. I would stay here again.

Great stay at the Holiday Inn Express in Garden Grove. My friend and I were in town for an awards banquet at the Paradise Pier Hotel at Disneyland, but we decided to save some money and stay at the Holiday Inn.  It was easy to get to, speedy check-in and check-out.  Our room was clean and the furnishings looked new.  Good-sized bathroom.  Lots of families there at the time because of the beginning of Spring break.  A little noisy in the morning from all the kids getting up - but no suprise.  We were down the street from Disneyland...only a couple of minutes drive down "West" to "Katella" then into the Downtown Disney parking area.  I would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: We had a problem, they fixed it
Summary: This hotel went above and beyond the call of duty to try and make us feel at home. When we booked the hotel, their web site said that they offered free shuttle to and from the airport and to and from Knotts Berry Farm. Well, when we called to confirm our reservation and the shuttle services, they told us that they don't run the shuttle that far away anymore. To make a long story short, although they don't run the shuttles that far away anymore, they made an exception and gave us taxi service to and from the airport and shuttle service to and from Knotts, as well as the daily shuttles to Disneyland.  The facilities were clean and well kept, and the breakfast was an expanded continental breakfast. Thanks Holiday Inn Express!!!
We stayed in this hotel for 5 night the first week in september and everything went perfect, service was great, their breakfast in the am was good too. we would def stay here again

very cheap, very good location for mainy places around the LA area. Disneyland is very close, Universal studios/hollywood probably 45 mins down the road. so perfect for exploring the area.  hotel itself was clean, modern, exactly what you'd expect.  would stay again.

We stayed here on 7/12 and 7/12/2005 on our family vacation.  I had some points and used them here while we were going to Disneyland.  We had stayed closer to the park the first four nights and this hotel was a breath of fresh air after that one!!  The room was huge and it smelled new.  All of the linens, including towels were nice and soft and just looked new and unused. The bathroom was SO nice and the towels had their own shelving!  The bed was very comfy and the TV had tons of channels to choose from.  It is close to the 22 Freeway but we didn't hear anything and our room faced the freeway.  We couldn't hear anything from any other rooms either.  Very solid room.  The check in desk clerks were marvelous.  Very friendly and seemed happy that you were there.  The workout room

After reading the last review, I was doubting about staying at the Holiday Inn Express Garden Grove But, we ended up going. I found the hotel to be quite wonderful. We stayed three nights and used the shuttle everyday to go to Disneyland. We found the hotelâ€™s staff to be very helpful and polite.  The Housekeeping staff did a wonderful job cleaning or room and nothing in the room was missed placed after we came back from Disneyland. We paid $79.00 a day for our stay and found the hotel to be worth the expense. At first the hotel seemed far from Disneyland but it is only about two miles away but with the free shuttle it is way worth the distance. My family and I will most definitely stay at this hotel for our future trips to Disneyland.

Excellent all the way! - Our 2 kids (7yrs/3yrs) had the most fun, we were safe and relaxed. The free shuttle to Disney works, you plan your day, make the reservations with the front desk and that's it. At night we needed to be picked up earlier and the hotel's operator was able to arrange the next available run for us. The rooms are beautiful, comfortable beds, very spacious bathrooms, I felt safe since it is all interior corridors.  We got lucky finding this place, the staff is courteus and very nice... they helped us order dinner, gave directions to a near pharmacy were we got my daughter cold medicine, they even remembered our kids names. If you are looking for the best at a good price go there. We were away from the crowds but not to far from the Disneyland area. They have

I went on a vacation to Disneyland with my 4 year old girl, this hotel is terrible, first, the staff is very rude, the maid STOLE from my suitcase 20 dlls and when I complained they told me the maid has been with them for a long time,and didnÂ´t believe me. I had to take my suitcases everyday to the front desk because I was afraid that the maid stole all my disney souvenirs (if she stole 20 dlls, she could take my daughter princess toys). The shuttle is terrible too!, you sign up for a pickup time and they get there with 1/2 hour delays. The hotel is far from disney, and there is no restaurant near by, so if you have a better deal stay somewhere else! We are planning to visit disneyland every year, but I NEVER going to stay in this hotel again!

Summary Heading: Holiday Inn Express Garden Grove, Great Stay
Summary: We have recently returned from a week long stay in California. We stayed in the HI Express Garden Grove for the last 5 nights of our trip.  The front desk staff were very helpful and we were checked in quickly. Our bathroom had a strong smoke smell even though it was a non-smoking room, we were moved to another room quickly and with no problems. The room was very clean and quiet. The breakfast seemed to be a little low on items, last 3 days they didn't have any of their signature cinnamon buns, but otherwise it was O.K. Not quite as nice as the previous HI Express we had just stayed at, but it was alright. We had a car and it was very easy to get to Disney and other areas of interest. There was a lot of parking and we never had trouble getting a spot, even when we returned late

My wife and I spent three nights (4/2-4/5) at the HI Express in Garden Grove.  We are frequent stayers at HI Expresses, enjoying the consistency of the experience from hotel to hotel.  This particular one met our expectations of a Holiday Inn experience... it just didn't exceed them.  We purchased our hotel stay on hotwire for $49/night.  A hotwire reservation gives you a "run of house" reservation - a room... just no guarantee of smoking/non or queen/king.  We ended up with a smoking handicapped room on the first floor at the back of this T-shaped hotel.  Although we are not handicapped, the well-equipped room was very well-designed for disabled visitors.  However, tip #1: avoid this wing. Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Anaheim
Summary: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Garden Grove for three nights, from 3/14 - 3/17 with my teenaged daughter, teenaged son and his friend.  We were quite satisfied with our stay there.  The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly.  The front desk clerk called our room shortly after we arrived to make sure everything was okay.  The next day the front desk clerk (a different one) took the time to call and find out the address of a post office nearby for me.  The room was quite adequate.  We had two queen beds. We requested a room on an upper level and it was very quiet.  The lobby is beautifully decorated.  The free breakfast was adequate.  One morning we arrived towards the end of the breakfast and they apparently had already run out of cinammon rolls.  They also had

The room and the hotel itself were nice. That's about all that was. The people working there are just downright rude. The housekeepers were lazy and left the new sheets for the sofa bed on the armrest, even though we left the sofa bed out. There was a free continental breakfast. However, if you attempted to take some food back to your room, there was a guy there to stop you. We wanted to take back food to our two young children. Then my room was booked on Priority Club points. When I checked out, they had charged my entire stay on my credit card! After going to the front desk to point out their mistake, they fixed it but never apologized. This place was a joke.
